name: Chardonnay Vin de Pays de l'Aude La Noble
review: Juicy, with good fig and apple flavors, and citrus and spice notes on the finish. Drink now. 6,600 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Vin de Pays de l'Aude La Noble
review: A light- to medium-bodied white with green pear and green apple flavors that finish on a spicy note. Drink now. 2,500 cases made.

name: Syrah Vin de Pays de l'Aude La Noble
review: Reminiscent of a Côtes-du-Rhône, with a rich, earthy aroma, berry, cherry and plum flavors, spicy notes on the finish. Drink now. 3,500 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Vin de Pays de l'Aude La Noble
review: Pretty apricot character is reminiscent of Viognier. Medium-bodied, fairly rich in texture. Flavors linger on the finish. 11,500 cases made.

name: Syrah Vin de Pays de l'Aude La Noble
review: Berry, dried cherry and red plum flavors fill up this workmanlike red.  Drink now. 5,500 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Vin de Pays de l'Aude La Noble
review: A straightforward Chardonnay, with some lemon and apple flavors and a spice note mixed in. Drink now. 17,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Vin de Pays de l'Aude La Noble
review: Straightforward, with modest dried cherry and berry flavors.

name: Merlot Vin de Pays de l'Aude La Noble
review: On the herbal side, with some bell pepper flavor and a tannic finish. 25,000 cases made.

name: Merlot Vin de Pays de l'Aude La Noble
review: Workmanlike but unexciting, with dried cherry flavors and some brown sugar notes. 3,800 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Vin de Pays de l'Aude La Noble
review: A bit thin and quite herbal-tasting. Lacks vigor. 3,300 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Vin de Pays de l'Aude La Noble
review: Fairly blunt, with modest fig and herb flavors. Finishes on an astringent note. 2,200 cases made.

name: Merlot Vin de Pays de l'Aude La Noble
review: A stinky aroma leads into stewy, bitter flavors. 11,000 cases made.

name: Merlot Moon Mountain District Pépé Cavedale Vineyard
review: Shows balance and good structure, with red currant and cedar aromas and firm flavors of cherry, mineral and spiced herb. Finishes with ripe but firm tannins. Drink now through 2022. 136 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Mount Veeder Le Roi Soleil
review: Exhibits bright, vivid, juicy red and black fruits that are supple-textured and linger on the aftertaste, where they maintain a fruity profile. Drink now through 2027. 209 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Mount Veeder Le Roi Soleil
review: Tight and firmly tannic, with a narrow beam of dark berry, oak, tobacco leaf and loamy earth at the core, turning supple and graceful on the finish. Shows promise for the future. Best from 2020 through 2030. 250 cases made.

name: Merlot Moon Mountain District Pépé Cavedale Vineyard
review: Sleek and structured, with floral cherry and red currant aromas and complex, slightly compact flavors of mineral, cedar and spicy dried herb. The tannins are dusty dry. Drink now through 2027. 150 cases made.

name: Tannat Russian River Valley
review: This features a solid core of bright red plum and dark cherry flavors, backed by fresh acidity. Notes of dried beef and green herbs show on the finish. Drink now. 360 cases made.

name: Tannat Solano County Rosé
review: This offers a light salmon hue and is loaded with spice notes, plus crisp flavors of apricot and cantaloupe. Drink now. 218 cases made.

name: Tannat Russian River Valley Rosé
review: Soft and easy, with modest notes of blood orange and spiced cantaloupe. Drink now. 105 cases made.

name: Colombard Russian River Valley Old Vines
review: A strange concoction, with sweet-and-sour apple cider and lemon notes that come across as limp and stale, and a wee bit foxy. 503 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma County
review: Great wine at a great price. A beam of acidity keeps the rich, ripe pear, citrus and melon flavors fresh and lively. Concentrated and deep, yet elegant and stylish, with a cleansing mouthfeel. Drink now. 590 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley
review: Richly flavored, with layers of fig, tangerine and pear, shaded by spice and floral scents. Full-bodied and persistent, if tapering off on the finish. Drink now through 2015. 2,820 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley
review: Rich and ripe, with baked apple, pear and fig flavors giving this a weighty mouthfeel, accented by spicy cedar and woodsy hints. Drink now. 3,250 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley
review: Clean and direct, if modest in scope, showing snappy green and golden apple, citrus and melon flavors, with a pithy citrus peel texture. Drink now. 2,100 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley
review: A firm, intense wine, with a spicy, peachy, green apple core of flavor that's somewhat raw and pithy. Should smooth out. Drink now through 2017. 3,850 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley
review: Sleek, with a rich, leesy green apple, peach and green pear edge. Clean and refreshing in a unoaked style. Drink now. 1,952 cases made.

name: Taureau Napa Valley
review: This expressive red offers zesty and appealing flavors of black cherry, grilled herb and spice. Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon, Syrah and Zinfandel. Drink now through 2025. 3,200 cases made.

name: Taureau Napa Valley
review: Sleek and supple, with appealing notes of jammy raspberry, spiced herb and cedar. Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon, Syrah and Zinfandel. Drink now through 2019. 2,500 cases made.

name: Taureau Napa Valley
review: Jammy and soft, with toasty black raspberry aromas and ripe cherry, caramel and licorice notes. Zinfandel, Cabernet Sauvignon, Petite Sirah, Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot. Drink now through 2017. 2,030 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley
review: Floral, with delicate pear, melon, spice and honeysuckle flavors that are medium- to full-bodied and pure, ending with a complex fruit note. Drink now through 2011. 2,500 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley
review: Complex, if on a modest scale, with creamy, smoky, toasty oak notes and subtle fig and tangerine-nectarine flavors. Drink now. 3,500 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley
review: A solid effort, with firm, moderately rich cherry and raspberry flavors at the core, ending with dusty, gripping tannins. Drink now. 790 cases made.

name: Syrah Napa Valley
review: Spice, cola, blueberry and blackberry flavors are complex and dusty, with a cedary oak edge. Firms up, ending with drying tannins. Drink now through 2013. 960 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Napa Valley
review: Green apple, melon, citrus and pear flavors have a charming spicy quality and tangy acidity, finishing with a peach cobbler vibe. Drink now. 927 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Sonoma County
review: A grassy, herbal style that exhibits juicy lemon-lime, tangerine and gooseberry flavors. This is refreshing, with a lingering finish. Drink now. 1,260 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley
review: Offers a dusty, savory core of Pinot Noir. Good but nothing more, as this fails to excite and is more solid than special. Drink now. 900 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Napa Valley
review: Fragrant, floral notes and bright citrus flavors are distracted by a coarse texture that runs through the core of the wine. A citrus pith edge offers a pleasant bitterness. Drink now. 1,360 cases made.

name: Taureau Napa Valley
review: Firm, intense and concentrated, showing spicy, loamy earth, dried berry, sage and herbal scents. Full-bodied, ending with chewy tannins and a dash of black licorice. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Petite Sirah, Syrah and Cabernet Franc. Drink now through 2014. 1,942 cases made.

name: Shiraz Mornington Peninsula ROC
review: There's a lively balance to the dark berry, licorice and pepper flavors, lingering on the refined finish. This is unusual for its refinement and balance, still showing pure and focused flavors. Drink now through 2013. 250 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Mornington Peninsula
review: Shows some restraint, letting the ripe pineapple and grapefruit flavors glide gently over finely tuned acidity, hinting at cream and mineral as the finish hovers for a while. Drink now through 2012. 3,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Mornington Peninsula
review: This velvety red lounges easily in the mouth as this offers cherry, mineral and pepper flavors that linger on the expressive finish. Drink now through 2012. 2,500 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Mornington Peninsula
review: Light in texture, with a pure bead of blackberry, black pepper and iron overtones. Finishes long, with finesse and fine tannins. Drink now through 2012. 2,100 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Mornington Peninsula
review: Firm, dense and crisp, with youthful berry and plum flavors mingling with touches of pepper and spice as the finish persists. Drink now through 2010. 100 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Mornington Peninsula
review: Light and spicy, with lots of clove and nutmeg weaving through the pear and citrus flavors, remaining light on its feet. Drink now. 2,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Mornington Peninsula
review: Lithe and generous, appealing for its peach, pear and slightly resiny aromas and flavors, lingering nicely on the juicy finish. Drink now through 2008. 200 cases imported.

name: Pinot Noir Mornington Peninsula
review: Tight, with firm tannins around a lively core of mulberry and tobacco flavors, finishing with refreshing balance. Best from 2011 through 2014. 2,500 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Mornington Peninsula
review: Firm, with ripe blackberry and cherry flavors at the core, lingering on the finish against hints of tar and smoke. Drink now through 2012. 750 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Mornington Peninsula Red Claw
review: Silky and refined, with pretty cherry and mineral flavors, veering toward orange peel as the finish lingers enticingly. Drink now through 2012. 6,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Mornington Peninsula
review: Smooth and generous, a lithe Pinot Noir with a lifted edge to the cherry and herb flavors that linger, echoing the pretty fruit. Rough tannins on the finish need time to soften. Best from 2009 through 2012. 3,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Mornington Peninsula Red Claw
review: Light and a bit tart, with a spicy edge to the modest berry and earth flavors. Drink now through 2013. 2,750 cases made.

name: Shiraz Gundagai
review: Crisp texture and currant flavors open out into meaty, borderline excessively gamy character, mingling effectively on the finish. Drink now through 2015. 500 cases made.

name: Shiraz-Tannat Adelaide Hills
review: Soft, supple and appealing for its cherry and herb flavors on a round, polished frame, a gentle wine that remains subdued through the finish. Drink now through 2008. 250 cases made.

name: Merlot Yakima Valley
review: Firm but fleshy, ripe and round, with a chewy undercurrent. Pretty berry and currant flavors weave in a spicy note on the long finish. Best from 1996 to 1997. 4,700 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley
review: Ripe, round and earthy, with decadent mineral, black cherry and leather flavors that linger on a long finish. Not for all palates; a serious wine. Best from 1998. 1,200 cases made.

name: Vintage Port Yakima Valley Johns
review: Harmonious, nicely balanced to show off its tobacco-scented plum and black cherry flavors, yet there's enough tannin and alcohol for grip. Approachable now. Made from Merlot. Best from 2001 through 2004. 645 cases made.

name: Merlot Yakima Valley
review: Spicy, herbal, sandalwood flavors meld nicely with soft black cherry notes to make this an appealing, distinctly cedary red. Ready now. 2,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Yakima Valley
review: Smooth and velvety, with spicy cherry and leather notes on a round frame. Drink now through 2002. 1,648 cases made.

name: Merlot Yakima Valley
review: Light, silky and appealing for its delicate plummy berry flavors that glide delicately through the finish, and persist. Drinkable now. 6,700 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Yakima Valley
review: Lean in structure, with focused black currant and pickle-barrel aromas and flavors that point through the softly tannic finish. Best in 1998. 4,350 cases made.

name: Johannisberg Riesling Yakima Valley
review: Fresh apple and peach flavors are soft and appealing. 1,200 cases made.

name: Lemberger Yakima Valley Rendezvous
review: Peppery berry flavors pump their way through this supple, high-energy red, finishing with a nice sense of balance. 812 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Yakima Valley Winemaker's Reserve
review: Herbal and tobacco aromas and flavors run through this one, echoing mint and oak on the finish, making this less charming than it could be. 350 cases made.

name: Merlot Columbia Valley
review: An attractive Merlot, with well-focused cherry, currant, herb and spicy cedar flavors that are elegant and not too tannic. Drink now. 2,850 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Yakima Valley
review: Ripe and round, with a funky, earthy edge to the blackberry and spice flavors. Approachable now; best from 1999 through 2003. 802 cases made.

name: Lemberger Yakima Valley Sof/Lem
review: A simple and dryish rosé. Appealing raspberry and rhubarb flavors linger on the finish. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Vintage Port Yakima Valley Johns
review: Sweet and distinctly spicy, almost bitter, offering cinnamon and nutmeg tones over modest black cherry flavor. Best from 1999 through 2001. 1,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Yakima Valley
review: Leans a bit heavily on exotic, spicy elements from aging in oak, coupled with a slightly sour streak, and finishes smooth. 1,308 cases made.

name: Lemberger Yakima Valley Rendezvous
review: Straightforward and flavorful, with simple plum and cherry flavors accented by a hint of herbs. Drink now. 2,560 cases made.

name: Merlot Yakima Valley
review: Strongly herbal, with flavors more from a pickle barrel than a fruit basket. Not for all tastes, but it holds together within its style. 2,315 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Yakima Valley Winemaker's Reserve
review: Earthy, slightly sour at first, but with enough pretty raspberry flavor to give some immediate appeal. Drink now. 350 cases made.

name: Merlot Yakima Valley
review: Light, smooth and decidedly earthy, nice but with a hint of vinegar sneaking in amid the modest leather and spice notes. Drink now. 2,726 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Yakima Valley
review: Earthy, gamy flavors dominate this moderately tannic, open-textured red. Better to try again in 1998. 980 cases made.

name: Chenin Blanc Yakima Valley
review: Light, soft, and semisweet. Flavors are simple and nondistinctive. 360 cases made.

name: White Riesling Yakima Valley Late Harvest
review: Sweet but blowsy, with a metallic edge to the flavors. 565 cases made.

name: Johannisberg Riesling Yakima Valley
review: Off-dry, with stale apple and floral flavors on a modest frame. 915 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley
review: An earthy, funky wine, with strong gamy aromas and flavors that compete with oak and ripe currant notes on the finish. Seems unbalanced; not likely to improve even if you cellar it. 3,420 cases made.

name: Lemberger Yakima Valley Lemberger Rendezvous
review: Earthy, stalky flavors crash detrimentally through an otherwise exuberantly fruity wine. 650 cases made.

name: Dry Fumé Blanc Yakima Valley
review: Smells like canned fruit cocktail, finishing a tad bitter. 2,350 cases made.

name: Syrah McLaren Vale Ruban
review: Juicy and vibrant, showing tangy raspberry and cherry flavors at the core, and spicy accents, with a firm finish. Drink now through 2026. 5,000 cases made.

name: Muscat Rutherglen Museum Show Reserve
review: Amazingly rich, ripe and powerful, gorgeous and unctuous, with layers and layers of spice, tar, coffee and molasses around a core of prune and apricot flavors. A great dessert wine. 1,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon-Shiraz South Australia The Caley
review: Elegant, plush and velvety, with expressive, five spice-scented plum and currant flavors that crescendo into more nuanced notes of vanilla, creamy milk chocolate and warm gingerbread. Generous throughout the epic finish, where details of sandalwood, fresh mint and cigar box linger. Drink now through 2030. Tasted twice, with consistent notes. 33 cases imported.

name: Muscat Victoria Museum Release
review: This Australian "sticky" rivals the quality of many more-prestigious versions, at a fraction of the price. It's a gorgeous mouthful of spice and walnut, sweet and opulent, and is deep with clove, coffee, dried litchi and berry flavors that linger with hints of tangerine peel on the finish. Yummy. Drink now. 3,500 cases made.

name: Sémillon Barossa Valley Late Harvest Botrytis Family Reserve
review: This Australian dessert wine is sweet and smooth, layering its pear, apricot, honey, caramel and tobacco flavors in a swirl of beautifully balanced sweetness. Long and vibrant on the finish, it should be best starting in 1999. 1,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz Barossa Hand Picked Single Site Hahn Farm Vineyard Light Pass
review: Ripe, rich and spicy, with layers of clove and cardamom around a plump core of black cherry and dark berry fruit, hinting at peppery cream as the finish lingers expressively. Drink now through 2020. 30 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Barossa The Octavius
review: Lithe and silky, with marvelous raspberry, red plum, cinnamon and cream aromas and flavors that jet across the palate, lingering easily on the expressive, refined finish. Drink now through 2017. 200 cases imported.

name: Shiraz-Viognier Barossa Hand Picked
review: Seamless, polished and remarkably expressive. A wine of uncommon balance that plays its ripe cherry, plum and mulberry flavors against wisps of cream, clove and white pepper, all of it mingling harmoniously on the long, refined finish. Best from 2009 through 2020. 225 cases imported.

name: The Reserve Barossa
review: Brilliant, vibrant flavors of currant, plum and blackberry show a purity and focus that carries them over a sleek frame, nicely framed by polished tannins. The finish keeps speaking eloquently without raising its voice. Cabernet Sauvignon and Shiraz. Drink now through 2017. 60 cases imported.

name: Muscat Victoria Museum Release
review: Silky and seductive, sweet, rich and loaded with flavor, offering coffee, walnut, orange peel, cherry, cream and exotic spice flavors that just don't quit. Drink now through 2020. 3,500 cases made.

name: Sémillon Barossa Valley Late Harvest Botrytis Family Reserve
review: Deep golden color and luscious, intense ripe pineapple, apricot, honey and vanilla, hinting at toasted marshmallow on the finish. Sensational now; should continue to improve through 2000 to 2003.

name: Shiraz Barossa Single Site Steeple Vineyard Light Pass
review: Polished, bordering on opulent, layered with jasmine and lavender accents to the plush blackberry and cherry flavors. Finishes with an open texture, showing density without a lot of weight. Drink now through 2020. 120 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Barossa The Octavius
review: Ripe, rich and powerful, with gorgeous blackberry, cherry and anise flavors at the fore, this shows hints of vanilla, cream and exotic spices lurking in the background, all of it echoing on the fine-grained finish. Drink now through 2015. 1,150 cases made.

name: Shiraz-Viognier Eden Valley Hand Picked
review: Vibrant and complex, this offers a tightly woven expression of plum, blackberry and grapefruit peel flavors, coming together seamlessly as the finish expands. Shows presence and depth. Drink now through 2020. 150 cases imported.

name: Viognier Wrattonbully FSW8B Botrytis
review: Silky, creamy, ultrasweet and fresh, offering layers of pear, vanilla and floral flavors that just won't quit on the beguiling finish. This has the intensity to improve with cellaring. Drink now through 2019. 70 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Coonawarra The Menzies
review: This refined, seamless, medium-weight style layers currant, blueberry, cedar and spice flavors that float through the supple finish and keep singing. Drink now through 2022. 120 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Coonawarra The Menzies
review: Lithe, generous and deftly balanced to play its ripe blackberry and currant flavors against hints of wet earth and bay leaf. The finish slides elegantly through refined tannins and a hint of charred meat. A lovely wine. Best from 2012 through 2017. 200 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon-Shiraz Barossa The Signature
review: Velvety, ripe and expressive, offering a full-bodied mouthful of dark berry, plum, chocolate and floral flavors that persist into a long and generous finish. The extraripe fruit lingers, showing real presence but not extra weight. Drink now through 2019. 120 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon-Shiraz Barossa The Signature
review: Fresh, vital and beautifully focused, offering vibrant currant and plum fruit on a polished frame, lingering easily against superfine tannins. Drink now through 2017. 300 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Eden Valley Wild Ferment
review: Vibrant, with a refreshing sense of youth to the pear, nutmeg and aniseed flavors, lingering delicately on the supple, expansive finish. Drink now through 2019. 400 cases imported.

name: Grenache Barossa Hand Picked Single Site Tri-Centenary Vineyard Vine Vale
review: Silky in texture, with vivid plum and rhubarb flavors that slip smoothly across the sleek frame and persist into the supple, generous finish. Drink now through 2015. 30 cases imported.

name: Grenache Barossa Old Bush Vine
review: Elegant, with plump, ripe raspberry flavors at the core, accented by hints of tobacco, licorice and spice. Powerful and pure on the long, expressive and creamy finish. Drink now through 2027. 1,200 cases imported.

name: Grenache Barossa Single Site Tri-Centenary Vineyard Vine Vale
review: Bright, velvety and appealing, with juicy red berry and fresh tomato flavors, gliding smoothly over a sleek frame, lingering well. Offers depth and subtlety. Drink now through 2018. 120 cases imported.

name: Grenache Barossa The Tri-Centenary
review: Expressive, vivid, aromatic and peppery, with an elegant approach to the spicy wild blackberry flavors at the core. The tannins gain some traction on the long, effusive finish. Drink now through 2030. 200 cases imported.

name: Grenache Barossa Valley Hand Picked Tricentenary Vines
review: Supple, silky and spicy, with a plush core of raspberry and rhubarb flavor in a beautifully balanced mouthful of attractive flavors and textures. The finish extends a long way and the texture is impeccable. Drink now through 2014. 200 cases imported.

name: Hand Picked MGS Barossa
review: Supple, ripe and expressive. A plush mouthful of currant, blackberry and plum fruit mingling with coffee, cream and floral accents. The tannins are almost not there, but the finish just sails on and on. Mourvèdre, Grenache and Shiraz. Drink now through 2015. 325 cases imported.

name: Museum Release Old Sweet White Barossa
review: Intensely sweet, spicy and exotic, with molasses and coffee notes around a core of dried cherry, walnut and smoky orange peel flavors that linger extensively. A complex dessert wine that deserves contemplation. Made from Muscadelle. Drink now. 1,500 cases made.

name: Port Australia Galway Pipe
review: Manages to be elegant while it pours out intense and complex spice, coffee, date and caramel flavors that linger elegantly on the sweet finish. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Port Barossa Valley Galway Pipe
review: A rich and opulent, sweet and generous Australian Port, layering its spice, sandalwood, cedar, raisin and tobacco flavors in a supple swirl that keeps spinning through the long finish. Drink now. 20,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz Barossa The Octavius
review: Dark and tarry in aroma, with lots of ripe cherry, chocolate and spice flavors carried by an open frame. Has intensity, but manages to feel elegant and lively. Best from 2011 through 2020. 150 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Barossa The Octavius
review: Ripe and exotic, a cascade of subtle flavors winding through a plump core of black cherry, berry and anise flavors, with toasty cardamom, pepper and slightly gamy notes hovering around the fine-grained tannins on the finish. Delicious already. Best after 2005. 70 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Barossa The Octavius Old Vine
review: Rich and ripe, with dense blueberry and dark plum fruit, shaded with cinnamon and white pepper hints as the finish sails on against refined tannins. Drink now through 2021. 100 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Barossa The Octavius Old Vine
review: A rich, generous Shiraz with a minty accent to the ripe blackberry, spicecake and tar flavors and a hint of anise on the long, elegant, chewy finish. Yummy now, but should keep growing through 1999 or 2000. 500 cases made.

name: Shiraz-Viognier Barossa
review: Smooth and generous, a lighter style of Shiraz that still has plenty of plum, berry and dried tomato flavor, finishing with a halo of sweet spices and a touch of mint. Just delicious, and the tannins are superrefined. 15 percent Viognier. Drink now through 2006. 1,300 cases made.

name: Shiraz-Viognier Eden Valley Hand Picked
review: A vibrant, fragrant wine, with plump cherry, peach and plum flavors at the core. Smooth and polished, this is accented by licorice, violet, black tea and nutmeg details. Lingers on the finish, where the tannins gain some grip. Drink now through 2030. 300 cases imported.

name: Shiraz-Viognier Eden Valley Hand Picked
review: Rich, focused and impressive for its deft balance, offering ripe cherry, rose petal, licorice and white pepper flavors that linger against refined tannins. Not a huge wine, but offers heft and depth. Drink now through 2020. 120 cases imported.

name: Tawny Barossa 50 Years Old Antique Museum Reserve
review: Dark and complex, sweet and tangy, with an open texture framing the grapefruit-tinged cherry, black coffee, walnut and dusky spice flavors. Shiraz, Mourvèdre, Grenache and Muscadelle. Drink now. 30 cases imported.

name: Tawny Port Australia 21 Years Old Antique Museum Reserve
review: Rich, dark and unctuous, its layers of crème brûlée, walnut, hazelnut and coffee mingling easily against lovely hints of molasses. The finish brings it all together harmoniously, and lingers beautifully. Drink now. 50 cases imported.

name: Tawny Port Barossa Antique Museum Release
review: Lightly sweet and elegant, not a huge, mouthfilling style but one that unfolds its walnut, nutmeg, cinnamon and coffee flavors on a lithe, silky sweet background. Drink now.

name: The Signature Barossa
review: Velvety and beautifully focused to show the depth of ripe currant, blackberry, grilled meat and smoke notes that don't quit on the long, deftly balanced finish. Cabernet Sauvignon and Shiraz. Drink now through 2015. 400 cases imported.

name: The Signature Barossa
review: Smooth, round and especially graceful, with the ripe blackberry, tar and licorice flavors settling gently into a supple frame. The finish lets it all linger like the glow of a red sunset. Cabernet Sauvignon and Shiraz. Drink now through 2016. 800 cases imported.

name: Viognier Eden Valley
review: Smooth and creamy, the polished texture supporting an explosive range of lemon meringue, pear, pineapple and spice flavors that ease into the long, vivid finish. Drink now through 2012. 1,500 cases imported.

name: Viognier Eden Valley The Virgilius
review: Detailed and elegant, there's plenty of intensity to the orange sherbet, lemon meringue and mango flavors in this white. Strikes the right balance between a crisp backbone of acidity and ripe, succulent fruit. Drink now. 500 cases made.

name: Viognier Eden Valley The Virgilius
review: Effusive but harmonious, this has the sunny character of Viognier, but corrals into a nice level of intensity and focus that shows off the floral, apple, quince and nectarine flavors beautifully. Drink now through 2012. 200 cases imported.

name: Viognier Eden Valley The Virgilius
review: Ripe, rich and dry, a huge mouthful of creamy---almost custardy---pear, melon and apricot flavors which are bathed in perfume. It keeps rockin' through a long, powerful finish but never loses its balance. Drink now through 2007. 75 cases imported.

name: Pinot Noir Yamhill-Carlton District
review: Pure, focused and elegant, a pointed mouthful of black tea-tinged plum and rhubarb, with pear peel tannins around the finish. Drink now through 2015. 350 cases made.

name: Pinot Blanc McMinnville Reserve
review: Smooth and lively, with a floral edge to the pineapple and apricot flavors, not too ripe, though, skewing minerally on the finish. Drink now. 700 cases made.

name: Chardonnay McMinnville
review: Crisp, lean and tangy, offering bright and zingy acidity that plays against the green apple and lime flavors. Has intensity and drive. Needs to flesh out a bit. Best from 2015 through 2018. 360 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris McMinnville
review: Jazzy, with lime, grapefruit and mineral flavors that keep zinging through the finish. Drink now. 600 cases made.

name: Chardonnay McMinnville
review: Lean and tangy, with crisp apple and floral flavors making up the narrow core, persisting into a lively finish. Drink now through 2017. 328 cases made.

name: Pinot Blanc Oregon
review: Bright and generous, delivering a lovely range of apple, floral and mineral flavors that echo on the ripe finish. Drink now. 450 cases made.

name: Pinot Blanc Oregon
review: A solid, refreshing wine, brimming with citrusy peach and apple flavors that linger gently on the smooth, open-textured finish. Ready now. 45 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley
review: Intensely ripe and concentrated, with vibrant fruit, moderately complex raisin, cherry and herb notes and ample oak flavor. Fully mature with a healthy red color. Ready to drink, but it can last until 1994.

name: Pinot Gris McMinnville
review: Light and sleek, with focused pear and white grapefruit flavors on a dry frame. Drink now. 500 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Willamette Valley Reserve
review: Crisp and refreshing, with a touch of walnut and spice to the pineapple and melon fruit, which echoes nicely. Drink now. 300 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Oregon
review: Deep purple color and very intense, packed with fresh ripe black cherry and berry flavors that are tart and vivid. There's a nice touch o f vanilla that runs through the wine, finishing rather tannic. Don't drink this one too young.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Reserve
review: Bright and simple, with a firm texture and nice black cherry flavors that last on the finish. Drink now. 575 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Reserve
review: Offers rich, ripe berry and spice flavors, but it also has a hard, tannic veneer that needs until 2000 to soften. Pretty chocolate and prune notes mark the finish. 1,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Oregon
review: Crisp and bright, offering nicely focused pear, mineral and floral flavors. Finishes a bit tight. Drink now. 2,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley
review: Light and silky, with pretty plum and berry fruit, finishing with fine tannins. Drink now through 2004. 2,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley
review: Light in texture, with exuberant berry, cinnamon and vanilla flavors that need until late 1997 or early 1998 to harmonize. 1,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Reserve
review: Lean and spicy, showing some nice roasted meat notes on the nose, with firm tannins surrounding modest cherry and white pepper flavors. Best after 2003. 900 cases made.

name: Pinot Blanc Willamette Valley
review: Bright and smooth, with offbeat mint and resin notes around a light core of apple and floral flavors. Drink now. 250 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris McMinnville
review: Light, with flavors of pear and sour lemon candy. Drink now. 1,038 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Willamette Valley
review: 2,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley
review: Light, almost crisp, with currant and cola flavors on an airy frame. Drink now through 2001. 2,550 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley
review: Smooth and fragrant, toasty, with a lean core of berry flavor struggling to poke through. Drinkable now.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Reserve
review: Medium-weight with spicy oak flavors and a nice glow of raspberry and currant notes. Drinkable now. 500 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Willamette Valley
review: Simple and fruity, dry, slightly coarse in texture; enjoyable for its freshness and youthful charm.

name: Pinot Noir McMinnville Estate
review: Light-footed, but dogged by gamy flavors, obscuring the dark berry notes at the core. Drink now. 4,312 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Willamette Valley
review: 1,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Estate Reserve
review: Despite attractive cherry and plum flavors, it turns dry and leathery, with a mild barnyardy character. Not for everyone.

name: Pinot Blanc Willamette Valley
review: Earthy, sour flavors detract from the ripe but modest fruit. 600 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley
review: Tart and bordering on sour, with earthy, mulchy flavors detracting from the cherry and plum notes. Not for everyone. 2,000 cases made.

name: Grenache McLaren Vale Old Vine
review: Rich, ripe and massive, redolent of all sorts of dark fruits--plums, blueberries, blackberries--that cascade over the palate like a roaring waterfall. Still, there's enough texture and grace to make it possible to warm up to this thoroughbred, and the finish sails on forever. Best from 2006 through 2012. 600 cases made.

name: Grenache-Shiraz-Mourvèdre McLaren Vale Cadenzia
review: A vivid red, rich and velvety, brimming with plum, blackberry and cherry flavors, wrapped in a veil of very fine tannins, weaving a dark chocolate note through the long, generous finish. Best from 2008 through 2015. 2,474 cases made.

name: Cadenzia McLaren Vale
review: Bright and jazzy, offering a riot of flavors, including plum, blackberry, floral and licorice notes that swirl through the finish against fine tannins. Grenache, Shiraz and Mourvèdre. Drink now through 2014. 4,215 cases made.

name: Grenache McLaren Vale Old Vine
review: A sturdy style of Grenache, generous but not as opulent as Shiraz, burying its ripe cherry and pomegranate fruit under a light blanket of dusky spices and superfine tannins. Drink now through 2014. 1,554 cases made.

name: Grenache McLaren Vale Old Vine
review: Tight, peppery style has generous black cherry and pomegranate flavors, lively acidity and fine tannins, beautifully proportioned, showing impressive depth and length. Needs time to let the pieces fall into place. Best from 2007 through 2015. 1,084 cases imported.

name: Grenache-Shiraz-Mourvèdre McLaren Vale
review: Big, rich and juicy, brimming with blueberry, plum, blackberry and black pepper flavors that are so lively they seem to jump out of the glass. The finish lingers intensely, cloaked in ultrarefined tannins. Drink now through 2012. 900 cases made.

name: Shiraz McLaren Vale
review: Has a wonderful sense of freshness to the blueberry and plum flavors, shaded with peppermint and a touch of espresso as the finish lasts and lasts against mildly grippy tannins. Has style without sacrificing purity. Best from 2006 through 2015. 1,158 cases imported.

name: Grenache McLaren Vale High Sands
review: Rich and ripe, bursting with plum and pomegranate fruit, shaded with smoke and tar as the finish lingers against polished tannins. Drink now through 2013. 150 cases made.

name: Grenache McLaren Vale Old Vine
review: Fragrant, with clove, sandalwood and white pepper accents to the pure core of ripe cherry, raspberry and kirsch flavors. Smooth and creamy. Drink now through 2027. 3,440 cases made.

name: Grenache McLaren Vale Old Vine
review: Sleek and lithe, with a meaty note running through the effusive blackberry and mint flavors, finishing with polish. Offers depth and intensity without weight. Drink now through 2018. 3,624 cases made.

name: Grenache-Shiraz-Mourvèdre McLaren Vale
review: Velvety, focused and generous with its peppery black cherry and tar flavors, persisting against a layer of fine tannins, lingering on the finely tuned finish. Drink now through 2013. 1,124 cases imported.

name: Shiraz McLaren Vale
review: Plum, mineral and toffee notes mingle with toasted cumin and black tea accents. Thick and chewy on the finish. Appealing for the intensity and long finish. Drink now through 2027. 7,830 cases made.

name: Shiraz McLaren Vale
review: Ripe and distinctive for its gamy, spicy character, a fleshy Shiraz with fine tannins wrapped around the generous berry and licorice flavors at the core. Finishes long. Drink now through 2010. 4,200 cases made.

name: Viognier McLaren Vale
review: Smooth and spicy, a generous mouthful of pear, floral and lychee flavors wrapped in a polished frame. Drink now. 200 cases made.

name: Cadenzia McLaren Vale
review: Toasty, spicy character competes against ripe cherry fruit, bringing welcome tension to this earthy blend. The finish persists impressively. Grenache, Shiraz and Mourvèdre. Best after 2008. 1,789 cases made.

name: Grenache McLaren Vale High Sands
review: Firm tannins surround a dark core of licorice-accented blackberry flavors on a lean frame. Lingers well. Best from 2015 through 2018. 135 cases made.

name: Grenache McLaren Vale Old Vine
review: Lithe and generous, offering a lovely beam of plum and floral flavors riding on a fine bed of polished tannins, finishing with a welcoming, open texture. Drink now through 2011. 1,806 cases made.

name: Mourvèdre McLaren Vale
review: Broad, open-textured and decadent in flavor, with earthy, meaty notes at the center, a nice cherry and spice mix coming through on the finish. Drink now through 2015. 183 cases made.

name: Shiraz McLaren Vale
review: Firm in texture, with a lean beam of savory notes and berry and currant fruit pushing through and persisting on the refined finish. Best from 2015 through 2018. 7,871 cases made.

name: Shiraz McLaren Vale
review: Smooth and lively, offering pretty plum and guava aromas and flavors that linger on the open-textured, crisp finish. Drink now through 2014. 8,000 cases made.

name: GSM McLaren Vale
review: On the lighter side, with an airy texture that allows the dark berry and chocolate flavors to float nicely. Drink now through 2016. 1,248 cases made.

name: Shiraz McLaren Vale
review: Not an over-the-top Shiraz, but one that finds a balance between its ripe blackberry and smoke flavors, fitting them into a modest structure that lets the finish sail on nicely against grainy tannins. Best from 2008 through 2012. 7,211 cases made.

name: Shiraz McLaren Vale Ironheart
review: Features a firm texture around the juicy core of peppery cherry and floral flavors, bursting into a long and harmonious finish. Best from 2015 through 2018. 230 cases made.

name: Shiraz McLaren Vale Single Vineyard
review: Ripe and velvety, this plush-textured red has a leafy edge to its blackberry and licorice flavors, finishing strong. Drink now through 2013. 5,778 cases made.

name: Viognier McLaren Vale
review: Ripe and broad, with pineapple and pear notes at the core, layered with exotic spice details as the finish lingers. Drink now. 262 cases made.

name: Chardonnay McLaren Vale Single Vineyard
review: Lithe and silky, with toasty oak notes weaving through the modest nectarine and citrus flavors. Drink now through 2010. 2,200 cases made.

name: Shiraz McLaren Vale
review: Supple and peppery, with a spicy feel to the soft cherry and plum flavors, lingering easily. Drink now through 2013. 10,000 cases made.

name: Grenache McLaren Vale Old Vine
review: Velvety in texture, with pretty plum and spice flavors that linger softly. Not as expressive as earlier vintages. Drink now through 2009. 1,480 cases made.

name: GSM McLaren Vale
review: Plump and juicy, with berry and spice flavors that are appealing and straightforward, shaded by black tea details on the finish. Grenache, Shiraz and Mourvèdre. Drink now. 1,074 cases made.

name: Roussanne McLaren Vale
review: Tangy, with a strong floral character that overwhelms the pear and apple fruit. Drink now. 200 cases made.

name: Roussanne McLaren Vale
review: Broad and spicy, with clove and nutmeg notes more prominent than fruit, finishing with cooked pineapple accents. Drink now. 225 cases made.

name: Shiraz McLaren Vale Appellation Series
review: Rich and plump, a flood of fruit, with powerful blackberry, plum and a wee touch of peppermint, all echoing through the long finish. A serious McLaren Vale Shiraz, built to last. Drink now through 2012. 5,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Coonawarra Appellation Series
review: Bold, ripe and generous in flavor, aristocratic in structure, with delicious blueberry-laced currant and plum flavors that remain round and appealing as they linger on and on. Beautifully structured, and it can grow in the cellar. Drink now through 2010. 5,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay South Eastern Australia
review: Lively and generous, a juicy mouthful of pineapple, nectarine and cream flavors, finishing with a distinctive balance between crisp acidity and polished texture. Drink now through 2003. 18,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay South Eastern Australia
review: Has subtlety and elegance. It's on the light side, but is generous with its peach and ripe apple fruit, with hints of spice and citrus on the finish. Drink now. 56,000 cases made.

name: Merlot McLaren Vale Appellation Series
review: Smooth in texture, with ripe strawberry, currant and spice flavors and more than a touch of spicy oak that lingers nicely. Drink now through 2005. 5,000 cases made.

name: Merlot South Eastern Australia
review: Soft, almost plush, here's a value-priced Merlot in a generous style, its spicy cherry and red plum flavors lingering with a hint of dusky herbs on the solid finish. Drink now through 2005. 18,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz South Eastern Australia
review: Light and refreshing, with raspberry and beet flavors lingering nicely on a lively frame. Drink now. 18,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon South Eastern Australia
review: Light, fruity, supple, appealing for its pretty cherry and strawberry flavors. Drink now. 48,000 cases made.

name: Merlot South Eastern Australia
review: Sturdy, pleasant red offers a nice core of blackberry fruit and a touch of vanilla to make it gentle on the finish. Drink now. 48,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz South Eastern Australia
review: Light and brightly fruity, relatively firm in support of its berry and mineral flavors, which echo nicely. Drink now. 5,500 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon South Eastern Australia
review: Light and zingy, with tart cranberry and cherry flavors. A distinctive style, but not a typical Cabernet. Drink now. 18,000 cases made.

name: Extra Brut Champagne
review: Mouthwatering, with fine balance and a lively bead. This offers notes of white peach, spring blossom, graphite, honey and pink grapefruit, with hints of black cherry and berry on the finish. Drink now through 2024. 125 cases made.

name: Brut Champagne Grande Réserve
review: Fresh and balanced, with an aromatic accent to the flavors of ripe apple, white cherry, lemon curd and biscuit. This is well-knit, with a fine bead and a clean, mineral-tinged finish. Drink now through 2015. 208 cases made.

name: Brut Champagne Sélection
review: A fine aperitif, well-balanced and fresh, with a delicate bead and appealing flavors of poached pear, almond financier and lemon zest, showing a hint of spun honey. Features a clean, lasting finish. Drink now through 2018. 1,125 cases made.

name: Brut Rosé Champagne Cuvée Rubis
review: Fresh, tangy acidity drives this personable rosé, which offers a subtle, minerally undertow, and flavors of wild strawberry, grilled plum and biscuit accompanied by hints of black currant and ground spice. Drink now through 2017. 208 cases made.

name: Brut Nature Champagne Roche Mère
review: Balanced and firm, with well-knit notes of lemon zest, green pear, pastry dough and subtle smoke. Clean finish. Drink now through 2015. 208 cases made.

name: Hermitage
review: Fine expression of Syrah, with blackberry, cassis, mineral and sanguine notes pumping through a dark, alluring midpalate. Notes of cocoa, grilled beef and truffle skitter in the background for added effect. Has some structure to shed first. Best from 2008 through 2025. 300 cases made.

name: Hermitage
review: Elegant, seductive, racy. A full-bodied red of wonderful refinement, with near-flawless structure as it caresses the palate with its supple, ripe and sweet tannins. Plenty of ripe fruit, some smoke and toast, along with mineral complexity. Sensational finish that seems to last forever. Domaine formerly known as Bernard Chave. Drink now through 2019. 580 cases made.

name: Crozes-Hermitage Tête de Cuvée
review: Big, and loaded with exotic purple and blue fruits--blueberry, plum--this packs a wallop, but follows it with ripe structure and a long, fleshy finish. Notes of violets and mineral add dimension. A star for this appellation in 2003. Drink now through 2013. 2,000 cases made.

name: Hermitage
review: This offers gorgeous aromas of warm ganache, Turkish coffee and steeped plum fruit, with the core of blackberry and fig paste, singed bay leaf and licorice root filling in quickly. Everything rumbles through the finish for now, but cellaring should round this into form. Best from 2017 through 2027. 30 cases imported.

name: Hermitage
review: Quite rich and velvety, with a lovely caressing feel to the crushed plum, fig sauce and macerated currant fruit. The floral, white pepper-tinged finish has a dusting of cocoa powder that should be absorbed with modest cellaring. Best from 2012 through 2019. 20 cases imported.

name: Hermitage
review: Really inviting, with crushed currant and blackberry fruit mingling with cassis bush, iron and mineral notes. Has a supple, lingering, violet-tinged finish. Silky. Drink now through 2020. 50 cases imported.

name: Hermitage
review: Packed with black currant, fig and black cherry fruit, this is also very refined, with incense, graphite, mineral and spice notes helping to extend the long, silky finish. Has power and grace and should age beautifully. Best from 2008 through 2022. 540 cases made.

name: Crozes-Hermitage Le Rouvre
review: There's a dense core of plum, cassis and macerated raspberry in this red, but the edges are silky, giving an inviting feel, while definition-adding iron and violet notes cut in on the finish. Offers fruit and minerality, welded together. Drink now through 2015. 75 cases imported.

name: Crozes-Hermitage Le Rouvre
review: Sweet and ripe, with lots of mocha, dark licorice, plum sauce and fruitcake flavors backed by a fine-grained structure and a long, mineral-tinged finish. Shows nice weight for the appellation. Drink now through 2011. 150 cases imported.

name: Hermitage
review: Lovely dark plum, anise and black currant notes are melded together, lined with smoldering cocoa and black tea accents. Shows a long, loamy echo through the well-toasted finish. Best from 2015 through 2020. 40 cases imported.

name: Hermitage
review: Racy and driven, with a lovely beam of blackberry, graphite, loam and spice notes that extend through the medium-weight finish. Long and well-defined. Drink now through 2017. 580 cases made.

name: Crozes-Hermitage
review: Dark and still quite tight, with serious structure framing the dark currant, plum compote and fig paste notes. The long finish is muscular but refined, with lingering iron and violet notes. Best from 2012 through 2015. 150 cases imported.

name: Crozes-Hermitage
review: Really ripe and pure, with a great beam of blackberry and currant fruit layered with iron, dark toast and violet notes. Long, silky finish. Drink now through 2011. 200 cases imported.

name: Crozes-Hermitage Le Rouvre
review: Dark and winey, with crushed currant, fig and boysenberry fruit laid over a strong graphite note. Additional tobacco, plum sauce and coffee notes fill in the briary finish. Best from 2010 through 2013. 2,080 cases made.

name: Crozes-Hermitage Le Rouvre
review: Has nice grip, with blackberry and black currant flavors, sweet cocoa and graphite notes, and a long, ripe, structured finish that delivers another wave of dark fruit. Drink now through 2013. 1,940 cases made.

name: Bourgueil La Petite Cave
review: A bit unyielding at first, but time in the glass coaxes an impressive range of dark olive, briar, mineral and currant notes that run through a structured finish supported by a solid, chalky spine, which holds it all together. Should open up nicely with cellaring. Best from 2008 through 2013. 20 cases imported.

name: Bourgueil La Petite Cave
review: This red is nicely toasty, delivering alluring black tea and anise notes, followed by rich blackberry, cassis and fig paste flavors offset by a sleek graphite underpinning. Long and suave through the finish, with well-embedded acidity. Frankly modern in style, and beautifully done. Drink now through 2018. 20 cases imported.

name: Bourgueil La Petite Cave
review: This is impressive, with mocha-tinged aromas leading the way for coffee, macerated plum, cassis and blackberry fruit, all woven with bittersweet cocoa, fresh olive and aged tobacco notes. The long finish lets it all hang together. Drink now through 2016. 458 cases made.

name: Bourgueil Le Grand Clos
review: Well-layered, with singed spice and a lightly roasted apple wood frame around the core of mulled plum, blackberry and black currant fruit. Offers a flash of anise on the finish, revealing a buried acidity. Drink now through 2016. 30 cases imported.

name: Bourgueil Les Quartiers
review: A dark, grippy red from France's Loire Valley, with charcoal, mesquite, roasted fig, dark olive and mineral notes coursing through while a backdrop of plum sauce and toast waits in reserve. The structured, mouthfilling finish drips with fruit and olive notes. Best from 2009 through 2017. 821 cases made.

name: Bourgueil Les Quartiers
review: A very ripe, modern-style Bourgueil--raspberry ganache and cassis fruit layered with bacony toast--but there's also plenty of terroir, with a great iron-edged finish that leaves a mouthwatering feel. Really solid. Drink now through 2012. 783 cases made.

name: St.-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil La Mine
review: Ripe, fleshy and driven, with a delicious core of crushed plum, cassis and blackberry fruit lined with dark tobacco leaf, singed chestnut, violet, olive and rosemary. The long finish features a deeply embedded chalky spine, giving this definition while remaining supple. Drink now through 2017. 50 cases imported.

name: St.-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil Les Malgagnes
review: This is very ripe, exhibiting delicious raspberry, black cherry preserves and macerated black currant fruit. But this is also sleek, racy and defined, with mouthwatering tobacco, iron and tapenade notes that fill in on the finish. Nicely stitched with the acidity. Cellar midterm. Drink now through 2014. 25 cases imported.

name: St.-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil Les Malgagnes
review: This offers the appellation's telltale iron, briar and dark olive notes, with a rock-solid core of black currant fruit. It's all given a lift by a layer of well-integrated cocoa and mocha-tinged toast. Drink now through 2012. 742 cases made.

name: Bourgueil La Coudraye
review: Vibrant cassis, black olive and savory notes course along, with an intense finish that lets the chalk spine shine through. Drink now through 2014. 200 cases imported.

name: Bourgueil La Coudraye
review: Pure and driven currant, fig, bittersweet cocoa and tapenade notes really push through the finish. Opens nicely in the glass. Drink now through 2012. 2,333 cases made.

name: Bourgueil La Petite Cave
review: This has melded nicely, showing a core of anise, blackberry and plum notes stitched with singed spice, smoldering tobacco and bramble accents. Reveals a buried iron note on the finish. Features solid grip and length. Drink now through 2017. 25 cases imported.

name: Bourgueil La Petite Cave
review: This racy red is a chalky spine driving the black cherry and black currant fruit, all backed by liberal tobacco and bittersweet cocoa notes. Grippy but fresh on the lengthy finish. Rock-solid. Drink now through 2012. 10 cases imported.

name: Bourgueil Le Grand Clos
review: Juicy and inviting, with a floral note giving way to bright cherry, red currant and damson plum notes, laced with a slight chalky hint that adds cut to the finish. Should fill out just a touch more with cellaring. Drink now through 2017. 30 cases imported.

name: Bourgueil Les Quartiers
review: This has just started to soften, as an alluring black tea edge moves in on the core of damson plum, raspberry and black cherry flavors. Long and suave on the finish, offering perfumy spice, incense and sweet tobacco notes. Drink now through 2014. 50 cases imported.

name: St.-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil Les Malgagnes
review: Lively, with open-knit blackberry, blueberry and cherry fruit, laced with sweet tapenade and spice notes. A bouncy edge on the finish lets the gorgeous, pure fruit play out without losing focus, while a tobacco edge chimes in for added depth. Drink now through 2012. 10 cases imported.

name: Bourgueil La Coudraye
review: Dark, but pure and very focused, featuring a gorgeous beam of cassis, blackberry and cherry fruit held together with a vibrant, chalky edge and followed by a long, floral-tinged, mouthwatering finish. Rock-solid. Drink now through 2015. 150 cases imported.

name: Bourgueil Le Grand Clos
review: Still fresh, despite the mature hints of tea and cedar around the edges. A lively core of mulled red and black cherry fruit is backed by tobacco and olive hints, with a lovely, perfume- and mineral-filled finish. Drink now. 25 cases imported.

name: Bourgueil Les Quartiers
review: Sports a chalky, slightly angular frame, with cherry pit, red currant, savory and olive notes all wrapped together. Sleek iron accents add cut on the finish. Drink now through 2015. 40 cases imported.

name: St.-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil La Mine
review: Shows coffee and fig aromas and flavors, followed by steeped blackberry and smoldering tobacco leaf notes that linger through the sanguine finish. Still a touch tight, so let this open with brief cellaring. Best from 2013 through 2017. 100 cases imported.

name: St.-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil La Mine
review: Fresh and racy, with alluring black tea and olive notes weaving through the core of black cherry and plum fruit. The polished finish lets a tobacco edge linger nicely. Drink now through 2011. 25 cases imported.

name: Bourgueil La Coudraye
review: This is solid, with a lightly grippy, brambly edge and dark cherry, currant and tobacco leaf notes wrapped up at the core. Sweet tapenade and a smoky hint weave through the finish. Drink now through 2015. 150 cases imported.

name: Bourgueil La Coudraye
review: Solid, with dark currant and briar notes backed by flint and iron hints and a lingering maduro tobacco note on the gutsy finish. Drink now through 2011. 200 cases imported.

name: Bourgueil La Coudraye
review: This shows nice ripeness and weight for the vintage, with fresh dark berry fruit and sweet spice notes offset by fresh acidity, an herbal hint and a taut, minerally spine. Drink now through 2010. 150 cases imported.

name: Bourgueil La Coudraye
review: Nice focus, with streamlined red and black currant fruit laid deftly over black tea, mineral and modest toast notes. The finish shows length and supple texture that belies the vintage. Drink now through 2010. 2,500 cases made.

name: St.-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil La Mine
review: Ripe, with layers of red and dark berry fruit offset by alluring tobacco, toast and mineral notes. Nicely rounded on the finish. Drink now through 2007. 75 cases imported.

name: Bourgueil La Coudraye
review: Nice smoky, tarry nose, with black cherry, iron, dark olive and briar flavors. Gutsy finish. Drink now through 2007. 200 cases imported.

name: Bourgueil Rosé d'Equinoxe
review: A very pale-colored, elegantly styled rosé, with watermelon rind, cherry pit and rose water notes. Persistent, with a lingering mineral note. Drink now. 25 cases imported.

name: Pomerol
review: Firm, interesting toasted oak, berry, dried herb character, medium body, solid tannins and medium finish. A négociant wine from a Belgian merchant. Mostly the second wine of Château Le Pin. Best after 1998.

name: St.-Chinian L'Engoulevent
review: Delivers a decadent meaty aroma, with refined flavors of wild plum, briar and kirsch. The dense, long finish is filled with cocoa powder and licorice, as well as plenty of mineral and smoke. Drink now through . 100 cases imported.

name: St.-Chinian Coccigrues
review: A full-bodied red, with lots of refined yet juicy plum, red berry and dark cherry flavors. There's a concentrated minerality to this as well, and an appealing earthiness. Finishes with fresh tannins and Asian spice. Drink now through 2014. 50 cases imported.

name: Napa Crest Napa Valley
review: This is polished and smooth upon entry, with creamy, mocha-scented oak joining ripe currant and blackberry flavors. Ends by returning to hints of chocolate, earth and dark berry. Cabernet Sauvignon, Malbec, Merlot and Petit Verdot. Drink now through 2026. 838 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Yao Ming Family Reserve
review: A pleasingly subtle and restrained style, graceful, delicate, supple and flavorful, offering a well-proportioned mix of rich currant, blackberry, plum and spicy, mocha-laced oak. Ends with a soothing finish that glides along the palate. Drink now through 2022. 450 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Yao Ming
review: A very tight-knit Bordeaux-inspired offering, with a smoky, cedary cigar box presence and tight dusty earth and dried currant flavors. Well done, ending with a cleansing aftertaste and hints of savory herb and tobacco leaf. Drink now through 2032. 2,608 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Yao Ming
review: Well done. Pleasantly ripe and supple, offering an elegant mix of currant, blueberry, dusty earth and cedar that's smooth and fleshy, ending pure and clean, with mild-mannered tannins. Drink now through 2022. 1,800 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Yao Ming Family Reserve
review: Tightly wound, dense and chewy, marked by dusty, loamy earth, cedary oak and graphite notes, with mineral-laced tannins. This will take years to unfold. Drink now through . 58 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Yao Ming Family Reserve
review: Trim and well-focused, featuring a tight beam of anise, dried berry, crushed rock and loamy earth, with hints of dried herb. This Bordeaux-inspired version sings on the finish. Needs time. Drink now through 2024. 638 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Yao Ming
review: Pleasantly herbal and supple, with a measure of tenderness to the core of dark berry, underbrush and gravel flavors. Drink now through 2025. 3,108 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Yao Ming
review: This Bordeaux-like offering tilts toward an austere style, featuring notes of dried berry, cedar, cigar box and fresh-turned earth. Dried herb and green olive nuances grace the finish. Best from 2014 through 2022. 3,187 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Yao Ming Family Reserve
review: Casts a long shadow of presence, with massive tannins and dusty berry. Well built if shy on obvious charm and fruitiness. Will gain from bottle age but may not wow. Best from 2016 through 2025. 63 cases made.

name: Napa Crest Napa Valley
review: Spicy, creamy oak notes jazz up the aroma and flavor, giving the dried currant, berry and licorice tones a little extra oomph. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Cabernet Franc, Petit Verdot and others. Drink now. 2,500 cases made.

name: Napa Crest Napa Valley
review: Trim and spicy, with a pleasing mix of firm, supple dried berry, spice, mocha, licorice and tobacco leaf. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Petit Verdot. Drink now through 2020. 2,690 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Napa Valley Napa Crest
review: Spicy pear, apple and citrus notes have a minerally edge, boasting vibrant acidity and an appealing intensity, with lemon and lime zest flavors on the finish. Drink now. 234 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Yao Ming
review: Cedary oak stands out, giving the texture a raw, woody edge. The core flavors are similarly edgy, with the tannins providing bite. Needs a little time. Drink now through 2024. 1,427 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Family Reserve
review: Dense and chewy, tilting toward dry, extracted tannins that are common in many 2009s and that clamp down tightly. The aromatics are more interesting, with loamy earth, licorice and dried berry. Best from 2013 through 2023. 300 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Dry and savory, a rustic style that's dense, chewy and tannic, offering glimpses of black licorice, loamy earth and roasted herb, ending with very dry tannins. Best from 2014 through 2023. 5,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Victoria
review: Not a huge wine, but the flavors of currant, mint and chocolate coalesce beautifully on a fine-grained frame, echoing on and on as the finish grows. Nicely done. Drink now through 2008. 5,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Yarra Valley
review: Pretty and graceful, a Chardonnay that eschews power for elegant pear, citrus and delicate earth, spice and honey notes, which get a bit stronger on the finish. Drink now through 2007. 4,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Yarra Valley
review: Bright and tangy, with a spicy edge to the lemon and pear flavors, lingering gently on the lively finish. Drink now through 2009. 500 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Yarra Valley
review: Light and appealing for its open-textured apple and citrus flavors, shaded nicely with hints of spicy oak, echoing nicely on the harmonious finish. Drink now through 2006. 150 cases imported.

name: Pinot Noir Yarra Valley
review: Light and fragrant, with plum and blueberry flavors on a fragile, polished frame. Drink now through 2006. 3,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz Victoria
review: Rich in texture, with a nice streak of acidity to support the licorice and cherry flavors. Drink now through 2006. 3,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz Victoria
review: Bright and crisp, with a zingy, mineral edge to the berry flavors, which persist nicely on the finish. Drink now through 2005. 4,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Yarra Valley
review: On the light side, with pretty raspberry and earthy mineral flavors, finishing with delicacy. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Yarra Valley
review: Lean and tight, with a tomato edge to the herbal berry flavors. Best after 2004. 600 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Yarra Valley
review: Earthy, slightly rubbery flavors intrude on the otherwise pleasant pear and spice. Drink now. 150 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Yarra Valley
review: Fresh, supple and generous, this beautifully proportioned Chardonnay offers a range of flavors on a modest frame; pear, apple, grapefruit and apricot capture the attention at various times, finishing with elegance and grace. Drink now through 2004. 2,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Victoria
review: Lively and zingy. Its bright passion fruit, citrus and apple flavors compete for attention, yet are harmonious. Ready now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Yarra Valley Reserve
review: Tight and firm, with a layer of hard tannins over a nice core of currant and ripe blackberry. Needs until 2001 to see what will become of the tannins.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Yarra Valley
review: On the lighter side for a Cabernet, with pretty raspberry and herbal flavors that linger gently on the lean finish. Best from 1999 through 2002. 2,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Yarra Valley
review: Shows some nice green apple, toast and earth notes and strives for elegance, but the elements have not yet achieved harmony. May be best from 1999. 25,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Victoria
review: Lots of mint and earth nuances weave their way through the pretty berry flavors. Firm tannins keep it from being as charming as it could be. Try in 1999. 5,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Victoria
review: A light, supple red with modest Pinot Noir character, offering currant and toast notes that linger gently on the finish. Ready to drink. 8,500 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Yarra Valley
review: Youthful and fragrant, with spicy berry flavors. Finishes a bit sharp, but it's promising. Try in 1999. 200 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Victoria
review: Rich and chewy, with a strong mint component to the supple plum and black cherry flavors, softening on the finish. Ready now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc South Eastern Australia
review: Broad and floral, herbal at the core, with a touch of sweet pear on the finish. 2,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Victoria
review: Light and a little bitter, with soft and modest flavors. Unimpressive. 2,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Yarra Valley Kiah Yallambee
review: Elegant, polished style strikes a lovely balance between the fruit, reminiscent of nectarine and lime, and the spicy oak, finishing with refinement. Has the length and intensity to develop with cellaring. Drink now through 2007. 3,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Yarra Valley Warranwood
review: Bright and juicy, with pretty red cherry and raspberry and a big, wide, earthy-gamy streak coursing through to the finish. Drink now through 2007. 1,500 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Yarra Valley Warranwood
review: Smooth, polished style offers nice dark cherry and meaty notes that linger on the open-textured finish. Drink now through 2005. 3,000 cases made.

name: Dry Red No. 2 Yarra Valley
review: Fresh and vital, open and appealing, offering a cascade of cherry, plum, coffee and dark chocolate flavors that come together harmoniously as the finish lingers with elegance. Shiraz, Mataro, Viognier and Marsanne. Drink now through 2020. 800 cases made.

name: Dry Red No. 2 Yarra Valley
review: Focused, complex, harmonious and distinctive, this red's meaty, savory overtones add depth to the glow of plum, currant and mineral flavors, which all glide easily through the long finish. Shiraz and Viognier. Drink now through 2025. 50 cases imported.

name: Dry Red No. 2 Yarra Valley
review: Fragrant and powerful, featuring sage, white pepper and eucalyptus notes up front, segueing into polished, herb-tinged plum and black currant flavors. Fresh and vibrant, with a firm backbone. Shiraz, Viognier, Mataro and Marsanne. Drink now through 2026. 1,500 cases made.

name: Dry Red No. 2 Yarra Valley
review: Lithe, refined and refreshing, a distinctively elegant style of Shiraz that emphasizes pure raspberry and strawberry fruit and a deft balance of polished tannins and acidity. Finishes with clarity along with floral scents. Shiraz and Viognier. Drink now through 2020. 50 cases imported.

name: Dry Red No. 2 Yarra Valley
review: Shows some transparency in the color and delivers a zing of acidity to balance the licorice-scented raspberry, rhubarb and tobacco flavors, lingering over nicely polished tannins on the finish. Shiraz, Viognier and Marsanne.--Australian reds blind retrospective.

name: Dry Red No. 1 Yarra Valley
review: Supple, subtle and distinctive for the licorice and mineral nuances that surround an expressive core of plum and fresh currant fruit, coming together harmoniously on the long finish. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Malbec and Petit Verdot. Best from 2014 through 2021. 50 cases imported.

name: Dry Red No. 1 Yarra Valley
review: Smooth and polished, this is a graceful red that's complex, with layers of dusky spice, earthy loam and subtle mint around a core of black cherry and rhubarb flavors, persisting into a distinctive, harmonious finish. Cabernet Sauvignon, Malbec, Merlot and Petit Verdot. Best from 2009 through 2017. 50 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Yarra Valley Underhill
review: Dark and chewy, a distinctive, raw mouthful of blackberry, licorice and vanilla flavors that smooth out a bit on the harmonious finish. Built for long-term cellaring, it should come together by 1999, keep improving through 2005 and beyond. 200 cases made.

name: Underhill Yarra Valley
review: Polished and sleek, this opens on a fragrant white-pepper note that mingles with cherry and raspberry elements, while fresh acidity keeps the flavors fresh and transparent, especially on the finish. Shiraz. Drink now through 2026. 1,500 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Yarra Valley
review: Light on its feet, this elegant wine offers welcome density to the plum, blueberry and wet earth flavors, lingering easily on the polished finish. Drink now through 2017. 50 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Yarra Valley Underhill
review: Smooth and toasty, with strong roasted nut notes weaving through the expressive blackberry, licorice and spice flavors, finishing with presence. Drink now through 2020. 600 cases made.

name: Shiraz Yarra Valley Underhill
review: Earthy, savory, sinewy and complex, this shows a brooding range of meat, spice and ripe plum flavors swirling through a medium-bodied frame, remaining open and expressive through the long finish. Drink now through 2020. 50 cases imported.

name: Dry Red No. 1 Yarra Valley
review: Subtle and focused, with dried sage, minerally clay and peppery accents to the firm, dense core of black currant and huckleberry notes. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Malbec and Petit Verdot. Drink now through 2026. 1,500 cases made.

name: Dry Red No. 1 Yarra Valley
review: Fresh and vibrant, with a thin veil of firm tannins wrapping around a lean core of minty, red pepperaccented black cherry fruit, finishing with refinement. This shows vibrancy, but feels tight. Needs cellaring. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Malbec and Petit Verdot. Best from 2013 through 2020. 50 cases imported.

name: Dry Red No. 1 Yarra Valley
review: Lithe in texture, with a welcome transparency to the complex bright berry, dark chocolate and roasted meat flavors that linger on the refined finish. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Malbec and Petit Verdot. Drink now through 2017. 50 cases imported.

name: Dry Red No. 1 Yarra Valley
review: Plush, generous and brimming with personality. A spicy red with gamy pepper and earth notes weaving through the supple red cherry and beet flavors. Attractive already. Best after 2003. 200 cases imported.

name: Dry Red No. 2 Yarra Valley
review: Distinctively spicy, with violet, peach and clove overtones to the earthy cherry and herb flavors. This is complex, and definitely not your typical Shiraz-based red, but it has class and depth. Shiraz, Marsanne and Viognier. Best from 2010 through 2017. 50 cases imported.

name: Dry Red No. 2 Yarra Valley
review: Bright and juicy, with a strong gamy note coursing through the flavors, barging through the juicy raspberry and floral flavors. Has a silky texture underneath a layer of prickly tannins. Shiraz, Viognier and Marsanne.--Australian reds blind retrospective.

name: Pinot Noir Yarra Valley
review: Light and tangy, with bright raspberry and orange peel flavors pushing through to a tart but silky finish, persisting impressively. Drink now through 2014. 50 cases imported.

name: Potsorts Yarra Valley
review: This rich, Port-style dessert wine brims with fresh ripe plum and cherry fruit, picking up coffee and dark chocolate hints as the finish lingers intensely. Tinta Roriz, Tinta Cão, Touriga Nacional, Tinta Amarela and Sousão. Drink now through 2023. 50 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Yarra Valley Underhill
review: A distinctive style, offering meaty, slightly gamy character around a supple core of cherry and plum fruit. The silky texture and elegant structure define this best. Drink now through 2017. 50 cases imported.

name: Dry Red No. 1 Yarra Valley
review: Sleek and inviting, with red berry and floral flavors picking up hints of chocolate and green olive on the finish. Has presence and persistence. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Malbec and Petit Verdot. Drink now through 2020. 800 cases made.

name: Dry Red No. 1 Yarra Valley
review: Ripe, deep, and gamy around the edges, with a meaty feel to the solid black cherry, anise and smoke flavors. A distinguished wine with room to grow. Drink now through 2005. 75 cases made.

name: Dry Red No. 2 Yarra Valley
review: Rich and leathery, with a core of ripe berry, plum and distinctly gamy flavors that stay round and generous on the finish, with a stroke of mint at the end. Has more of a Rhône-like feel than do most Aussie Shirazes. A blend: 95 percent Shiraz, 5 percent Viognier. 60 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Yarra Valley
review: Light and refined, with pretty blackberry and currant fruit in a silky package, lingering nicely with hints of tobacco and loam. Drink now through 2014. 50 cases imported.

name: Pinot Noir Yarra Valley
review: Silky and appealing for its lovely berry and spice flavors, lingering on the polished finish. Drink now through 2012. 50 cases imported.

name: Pinot Noir Yarra Valley
review: Ripe and spicy, with distinctive plum, prune and berry flavors shaded with clove and chocolate overtones on a silky frame. Drink now through 2004. 100 cases imported.

name: Pinot Noir Yarra Valley
review: Elegant and refined, with nicely defined plum and berry flavors, shaded with hints of leather and herb and just a touch of spice on the supple finish. Drink now through 2001.

name: Shiraz Yarra Valley Underhill
review: Ripe and funky, with a distinct gamy note dominating the spicy blackberry and licorice flavors. Stylish, but the flavors will not appeal to everyone. Drink now through 2014. 50 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Yarra Valley Underhill
review: Dark, dense and gamy, with distinct earthy notes running through the black cherry and plum flavors, finishing with length, echoing a curious pickle-barrel character. Drink now through 2010. 100 cases imported.

name: Dry Red No. 1 Yarra Valley
review: Light and focused in flavor, centering on plum and currant flavors that keep echoing on the uncharacteristically pure finish. Very pretty to drink already. Drink now through 2002.

name: Shiraz Yarra Valley Underhill
review: Distinctively gamy, with a sweet, earthy, decadent feel to the silky berry and smoke flavors. Not a mainstream wine, but it has personality. Best from 2000 through 2005.

name: Pinot Noir Yarra Valley
review: Ripe and concentrated, showing lots of smoky blackberry, plum and pepper flavors, it's one of the more focused Australian Pinot Noirs. Best from 1999. 50 cases made.

name: Sémillon Coldstream
review: Very tart and vegetal in a big, rich, full bodied style. Fairly powerful, may be too much for some. A Sémillon for the hearty. But at $17?

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Coldstream Dry Red Wine No. 1
review: Overripe style, almost pruny, with soft structure and scratchy tannins not quite enough to give it the backbone it needs. Drinkable in a somewhat port y style.

name: Brut Australia Thibaut & Gillet Cuvée
review: Yeasty, with tart apple notes and a lean structure. 750 cases made.

name: Cabernet-Shiraz Australia Wybong
review: Ripe, rich and generous, layering its plum, berry, toast, vanilla and spice flavors on a smooth, velvety background. Has a minty accent that adds extra interest. Needs time to develop and expand. Best after 2000. 500 cases made.

name: Chardonnay South Eastern Australia Hay Burner
review: Soft and fragrant, with pear and floral aromas and flavors, lingering on the gentle finish. Drink now. 1,500 cases made.

name: Cabernet-Merlot South Eastern Australia Hell Raiser
review: Open-textured and appealing for its straightforward currant flavors. Drink now. 1,500 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay South Eastern Australia Hay Burner
review: Soft, fruity and juicy, with apple and pear flavors. Drink now. 1,500 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Hunter Valley Barrington
review: Woody aromas and flavors predominate in this serious-minded but dull wine. 1,500 cases made.

name: Shiraz South Eastern Australia
review: Ripe and spicy, this dark wine has a strong tang of licorice shading the basic blackberry flavors. Finishes with a flourish. Drink now through 2001. 800 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon-Shiraz South Eastern Australia
review: Firm and chunky, offering a solid mouthful of anise-scented black cherry and berry flavors that linger on the softly chewy finish. Tasty now. 60 percent Cabernet Sauvignon, 40 percent Shiraz. 5,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Hunter Valley
review: Smooth and silky, with a spicy, earthy note running through the pretty pear and delicate herb flavors. Don't wait. Drink now. 3,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Hunter Valley Barrington
review: Wonderful texture--smooth, soft, silky and spicy, and some pretty apple, earth and nutmeg flavors. Drink now. 1,500 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Hunter Valley Barrington
review: Feels crisp and juicy, with a honeyed tinge to the bright pineapple flavors. Finishes with an open texture. Drink now through 2001. 1,000 cases imported.

name: Mountain Mount Veeder
review: Firm, tight and intense, with a strong mineral and graphite edge to the dried currant, black cherry and sage flavors. Full-bodied, well-proportioned and balanced. The tannins are gripping. Needs time. Cabernet Sauvignon. Best from 2010 through 2018. 116 cases made.

name: Forest Judean Hills
review: Shows minerally and savory accents to the wild berry, cherry and plum pudding flavors, matched to notes of hot stone. Cocoa powder details emerge on the powerful, spiced finish, capped by a creamy lushness. Cabernet Sauvignon and Petit Verdot. Kosher. Drink now through 2019. 250 cases imported.

name: Mt. Amasa Judean Hills
review: A suave and lithe red, with pure, mineral-infused flavors of cherry, cedar, dried raspberry and juniper berry. Porcini mushroom and forest floor notes emerge on the bright, savory finish. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Shiraz, Petit Verdot and Malbec. Kosher. Drink now through 2019. 350 cases imported.

name: Petit Verdot Judean Hills
review: A powerful, rich red filled with luscious dark plum, dried blackberry and dark currant flavors, matched to black pepper and Asian spice notes. Hot stone details emerge on the minerally finish. Kosher. Drink now through 2020. 200 cases imported.

name: Yatir Forest Judean Hills
review: Very Bordeaux in style, with concentrated red plum and cherry flavors and enticing herbal and mineral elements. This is muscular and lithe, with a finish of mocha, meat and spice. Distinctive. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Shiraz. Kosher. Drink now through 2012. 400 cases imported.

name: Syrah Judean Hills
review: A ripe red, with concentrated flavors of dark plum, black currant and olive, flanked by notes of allspice and dried mint. Peppery details show on the finish. Kosher. Drink now through 2019. 150 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon-Merlot-Shiraz Judean Hills
review: Dense and ripe, with dark plum and chocolate flavors. Shows savory herb and olive notes as well, with hints of mint. Kosher. Drink now through 2010. 1,000 cases imported.

name: Red Wine Judean Hills
review: There's lots of peppery notes in this ripe, mature-tasting red, which features dried plum and cherry flavors, with good cut to the minerally notes. Finishes with mint and chocolate.
