Merlot, Shiraz, Cabernet Sauvignon, Petit Verdot, Malbec and Cabernet Franc. Kosher. Drink now. 500 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Judean Hills
review: There's good power and definition to the green olive, dried berry and roasted plum flavors, with plenty of savory notes on the still-crisp finish. Kosher. Drink now. 350 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Judean Hills
review: Taut, with notes of green herbs to the dried cherry and stewed plum flavors. White pepper details show on the finish. Kosher. Drink now. 250 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Judean Hills
review: Ripe and juicy, with firm dried berry and dark plum flavors, accented by smoke and savory herb. Mocha and espresso mark the finish. Kosher. Drink now. 325 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon-Merlot Yatir Forest-Judean Hills
review: Pretty berry and cherry flavors are balanced by a firm structure, with a lingering finish of sweet spice. Kosher. Drink now. 1,375 cases made.

name: Merlot-Shiraz-Cabernet Judean Hills
review: Dense, with good concentration to the dark fruit flavors, which are accented by plenty of smoky and spicy notes. Blackberry and dark plum dominate, with some chocolaty notes on the short finish. Kosher. Drink now. 200 cases imported.

name: Red Wine Judean Hills
review: This supple, medium-bodied red offers lots of crushed red plum and cherry flavors. Savory herb marks the finish. Merlot, Shiraz, Cabernet Sauvignon, Malbec, Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot. Kosher. Drink now. 350 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Yatir Forest-Judean Hills
review: Plum, dark cherry and berry flavors fill this full-bodied red. Bell pepper chimes in on the crisp finish. Kosher. Drink now. 400 cases made.

name: Forest Judean Hills
review: A charry, herbal essence surrounds the blackberry, currant and pepper flavors in this medium-bodied red, with astringent tannins. Concludes with a moderate, spiced finish. Kosher. Drink now. 2,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Negev
review: Tropical fruit flavors, with canned peachy notes, fill this soft white. Kosher. Drink now. 500 cases imported.

name: Pinot Noir Awatere Valley Single Vineyard
review: A plush and supple red, brimming with flavors of raspberry coulis, cherry, rosemary, dried rose petal, forest floor and smoky black tea. Harmonious, focused and pure, with nice persistence on the finish, where pepper and citrus peel hints chime in. Drink now through 2023. 4,889 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Marlborough
review: Tight and beautifully focused, delivering a juicy mouthful of raspberry, wild strawberry and pomegranate flavors that linger on the sleek, bright finish. Drink now through 2014. 5,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Marlborough Peter Yealands
review: Plush and supple, with a juicy quality to the plum, raspberry and wild strawberry flavors. Fresh earth, cedar and spicy black licorice notes sneak in on the finish, along with a dried rose petal accent. Drink now through 2025. 18,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Awatere Valley Estate Single Vineyard
review: The tangy ruby grapefruit and lime zest flavors show intensity and focus, with a fleshy, peach-accented core and a juicy, white pepper-scented finish. Drink now. 22,200 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Awatere Valley Single Vineyard
review: The melon, peach and apricot flavors are fresh and vibrant, offering a fleshy succulence balanced against vibrant, lime juice-tinged acidity. A savory, saline detail emerges on the finish. Drink now. 200 cases imported.

name: Pinot Noir Awatere Valley Single Vineyard
review: Rich black cherry, plum paste and wild strawberry flavors are plump, accented by notes of roasted herb, cedar, spice and black tea that linger on the finish. Drink now through 2027. 4,500 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Marlborough Peter Yealands
review: Juicy cherry and raspberry flavors are fresh and bright, with a smooth, supple body and notes of clove, cherry cola and vanilla bean. Polished and elegant, with a long finish. Drink now through 2027. 20,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Marlborough Peter Yealands
review: Complex, effusive and fruity at the core, offering white pepper, Earl Grey tea and cola aromas that give way to supple raspberry and cherry flavors. Touches of wild blackberry and spice box show on the finish. Drink now through 2023. 22,222 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Awatere Valley Estate Single Vineyard
review: Succulent and generous, reminiscent of a mango lassi, with pure, ripe fruit flavors and a creamy texture. Offers shades of fresh herbs, tropical and floral details and a mineral finish. Drink now. 13,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Awatere Valley S1 Single Block
review: Grapefruit and lemongrass flavors are bold and juicy, with lime zest, fresh ginger and melon notes lingering on the finish. Drink now. 4,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Awatere Valley S1 Single Block
review: Passion fruit, Key lime and tangerine flavors are vibrant and expressive, with a touch of celery leaf and lemon on the crisp finish. Drink now. 125 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Awatere Valley Single Block S1
review: Light and crisp, with a vivid and bright acidity that provides a good backbone for the lime, white grapefruit and pear flavors. A whiff of passion fruit and spice emerges on the long finish. Drink now. 3,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: Bright and focused, offering a lively mouthful of pear, grapefruit and floral aromas and flavors on a juicy frame, finishing with finesse. Drink now. 75,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough Peter Yealands
review: Whiffs of smoke and honeysuckle add an aromatic accent to the core of peach, pear and mango flavors in this white, which is juicy on the long, crisp, clean finish. Drink now. 277,777 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough Peter Yealands
review: Papaya, lemon, dried mango and lime flavors burst out of the glass, with a detail of lemongrass on the finish. This has plenty of juicy acidity but comes across as light and smooth. Drink now. 25,277 cases made.

name: Peter Yealands P.G.R. Marlborough
review: A fragrant floral highlight mingles with pear and citrus flavors in this intense white, ending with a juicy finish that shows a lingering honeysuckle accent. Pinot Gris, Riesling and Gewürztraminer. Drink now. 6,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Awatere Valley Estate Single Vineyard
review: Peppery up front, offering a good mix of earth, sage and plum compote flavors. Hints of baking spices linger in the background. Presents a sleek, smooth frame. Drink now through 2026. 3,400 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Awatere Valley Single Vineyard
review: Smooth, offering a mix of plum pudding, clove and cola flavors, with apricot, vanilla bean and fresh sage notes, lingering on the finish. Drink now through 2026. 3,500 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Marlborough Peter Yealands
review: Stylish, with plum and dark cherry flavors, accented by Earl Grey tea, nutmeg and cigar box details. Polished, juicy and harmonious on the finish. Drink now through 2026. 4,000 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Awatere Valley Estate Single Vineyard
review: Light-bodied, but full of intense lemon, lime and grapefruit flavors, with a touch of passion fruit in the background. Features impressive freshness and intensity, especially on the finish. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Awatere Valley Single Vineyard
review: A touch of sweet pea rounds out the core of crisp lemon, lime and grapefruit flavors in this focused version, with appealing minerality supporting the lemongrass and white flower blossom notes on the refreshing, juicy finish. Drink now. 13,333 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Awatere Valley Single Vineyard
review: This appealing white shows fresh herbal details of lemon verbena and lemongrass, with lip-smacking flavors of Key lime, apple and grapefruit on a slightly fleshy body. Drink now. 13,889 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Awatere Valley Estate Single Vineyard
review: Fresh orange zest and floral aromatics give way to juicy raspberry and strawberry flavors. Fresh herb notes are generous on the finish. Drink now through 2019. 2,700 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Awatere Valley Estate
review: This jazzy white is lively with peach and grapefruit, offering a hint of passion fruit on the finish, lingering well. Narrows a bit on the finish. Drink now. 50,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: Appealing for its tangy approach to the citrus flavors, with tart green apple and honeydew melon notes and a lip-smacking mango-flavored finish. Drink now. 25,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough Peter Yealands
review: This intense and minerally white features a strong presence of sea salt to accentuate the bright lemon, lime zest and ruby grapefruit flavors at the core. A pure and refreshing version. Drink now. 155,556 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Marlborough Peter Yealands
review: Shows good intensity to the lemon, lime and pear flavors. Light and juicy, lingering with accents of honey and lemon thyme. Drink now. 54,444 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Awatere Valley Estate Single Vineyard
review: The crisp citrus notes display a peachy accent, with appealing lemon grass and thyme aromatics and a good punch of acidity. Drink now. 560 cases imported.

name: Pinot Gris Marlborough Peter Yealands
review: Light and refreshing, this has a juicy mix of apple and pear flavors, with hints of thyme imparting an aromatic grace note. Drink now. 2,425 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Marlborough Peter Yealands
review: Tangy lemon, pear and lemongrass flavors are crisp and refreshing, with a spicy, juicy finish and a supple frame. Drink now. 33,333 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Marlborough Way
review: Citrus and melon flavors have a grassy and herbal edge, with spicy, peppery details on the juicy finish. Drink now. 27,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Marlborough-Central Otago
review: This is highlighted by fresh herbal notes of caraway and sage, as dried lavender accents mingle with tangy berry and cherry flavors that are crisp and juicy. Drink now. 7,500 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: Refreshing and on the grassy side, with tangy apple and grapefruit flavors and a strong mineral note. Drink now. 15,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: Light and zippy, a smooth-textured style, with pineapple and grapefruit flavors that linger easily. Drink now. 100,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough Premium Selection
review: Plenty of Key lime, melon and pineapple flavors come together in this light-bodied, refreshing white. Fragrant and juicy. Drink now. 12,000 cases imported.

name: Pinot Noir Marlborough-Central Otago
review: Offers a trim band of strawberry, cranberry and white pepper notes that are smooth, crisp and refreshing, with pleasing fresh herb notes on the finish. Drink now. 5,000 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough Peter Yealands
review: Shows plenty of green bean and celery leaf accents to the mouthwateringly crisp lemon and lime notes, with bracing acidity. Drink now. 122,222 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough Premium Selection
review: Made in a light-bodied, elegant style, with balanced and refreshing notes of lemon-lime, fresh grass and herb. Drink now. 7,500 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Vin de Pays d'Oc
review: Grassy-tasting, with Meyer lemon flavors and an herbal tinge to the short finish. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Vin de Pays d'Oc

review: Blackberry, vanilla and peach flavors are vibrant and pleasantly chewy. Spice and cedar details linger on the finish. Drink now. 2,250 cases made.

name: Yarra Valley
review: A solid red, nicely packed with berry, currant and plum flavors, this is a tight wine that promises richness by 2000 or so. Tannins are well integrated and the cedary flavors add interest on the finish. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Cabernet Franc. 600 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Yarra Valley
review: The robust plum and cherry flavors have a touch of vanilla bean and toast on the finish. Drink now. 4,500 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Yarra Valley
review: Light and appealing for its pretty currant and dusky spice aromas and flavors. A pleasant drink, though the chalky texture on the finish isn't ideal. Drink now through 2009. 1,500 cases imported.

name: Pinot Noir Yarra Valley Reserve
review: Earthy, with a woodsy edge to the modest berry and spice flavors, finishing with an open texture. Drink now through 2013. 1,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Yarra Valley Reserve
review: Firm style offers solid blackberry flavors and toasty, spicy overtones that come together on a solid finish. Best after 2002. 500 cases made.

name: Shiraz Yarra Valley
review: Has density, but the tart edge, bordering on vinegary, takes away much of the charm. The finish has persistence, but the flavors won't please everyone. Drink now through 2010. 500 cases imported.

name: Shiraz-Viognier Yarra Valley Village
review: Tangy cherry and raspberry flavors are crisp and taut, with herbal and white pepper shadings that linger on the balanced finish. Drink now. 500 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Yarra Valley
review: Firm, with good depth to the dried berry flavors. Dry tannin and chocolate notes on the finish. Drink now through 2003. 3,300 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Yarra Valley
review: Light in texture, with a sour edge to ripe currant and plum flavor riding over a layer of fine tannins. Drink now through 2009. 1,000 cases imported.

name: Pinot Noir Yarra Valley Rosé E.D.
review: Lithe in texture, appealing for its earthy Pinot character, finishing with a bright note. Drink now. 300 cases imported.

name: M.V.R. Yarra Valley
review: Soft in texture, modest in flavor, with pear and almond notes. Drink now. 500 cases imported.

name: Shiraz South Eastern Australia Barak's Bridge
review: Light and fruity, with pretty blackberry and orange peel aromas and flavors, finishing soft. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz Yarra Valley
review: Has a lovely core of rich berry fruit, but it's blurred with earthy, muddy, metallic flavors that keep it from being friendly. Best after 2006. 400 cases imported.

name: Pinot Noir South Eastern Australia Barak's Bridge
review: Very light, almost rosé-like, with modest strawberry and leather flavors. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Yarra Valley
review: Overly tangy, with a vegetal component to the lime and apple flavors, finishing simple.   8,000 cases made.

name: Merlot Yarra Valley
review: Crisp, herbal and hard-edged, with overly bright acidity and with focused berry and dried sage flavors. 800 cases made.

name: Shiraz Yarra Valley
review: Fresh and vibrant, open-textured and relatively light on its feet, with sweet spice and black pepper notes that weave through the plum and fresh currant fruit, echoing on the elegant finish. Drink now through 2022. 50 cases imported.

name: Yarra Valley
review: Dense and rustic, with sinewy tannins and tar, graphite and tobacco accents to the thick, chewy core of blackberry and plum. There's plenty of charm here, and much hope for the cellar. Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc, Merlot, Malbec and Petit Verdot. Drink now through 2030. 25 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Yarra Valley
review: Intense, with tropical overtones of pineapple and passion fruit complementing the core of citrus and melon. Powerful acidity carries the flavors through the finish. Drink now through 2020. 25 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Yarra Valley
review: Light, lively, vibrant and delicious, with pineapple, pear, floral and passion fruit flavors, lingering on the extended, tangy finish. Drink now through 2018. 50 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Yarra Valley
review: Sleek, racy and appealing, with juicy pear, green apple and lime flavors, picking up stony notes as the finish lingers effortlessly. Drink now through 2019. 25 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Yarra Valley
review: Elegant, featuring white pepper and talcum powder notes opening with an aromatic air. Wild strawberry, pomegranate and roasted herb elements complement the dried cherry flavors at the core, smooth and weightless. Drink now through 2027. 25 cases imported.

name: Viognier Yarra Valley
review: This Viognier tries to show restraint, losing some ebullience but still managing to pull together into a focused, distinctive white. Finishes with finesse. Drink now through 2016. 25 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Yarra Valley
review: Light, polished and appealing for its yellow peach, floral and dusky spice aromas and flavors, lingering gently on the refined finish. Has style and restraint. Drink now through 2011. 30 cases imported.

name: Pinot Noir Yarra Valley
review: Light and tangy, with a smooth surface that wraps around a lively core of dark berry, plum and mineral flavors, lingering easily against refined tannins. Drink now through 2014. 50 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Yarra Valley
review: Strikes an impressive balance between smoky sandalwood aromatics and fleshy, ripe, bold black cherry flavors. Gains intensity and traction on the finish, with a touch of dried apricot and a lingering cedar accent. Drink now through 2026. 25 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Yarra Valley
review: A refreshing style that offers floral-accented blackberry flavors on a sleek, polished frame, finishing with an open texture. Drink now through 2015. 25 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Yarra Valley
review: There is a transparency to the red berry and black cherry flavors, with earthy, spicy overtones, hinting at cinnamon and clove as the lithe, elegant finish lingers easily. Drink now through 2018. 50 cases imported.

name: Viognier Yarra Valley
review: Lithe, focused and juicy, with pear and pineapple flavors, weaving spicy notes through the long and lively finish. Drink now through 2019. 50 cases imported.

name: Viognier Yarra Valley
review: Deftly balanced, open-textured and gently aromatic, with white pepper and ginger accents to the lemon and pear flavors. Has a refreshing quality. Drink now through 2018. 25 cases imported.

name: Viognier Yarra Valley
review: Smooth and round, a juicy, effusive mouthful of pear, spice and tobacco flavors, remaining light and vibrant through the deftly balanced finish. Drink now. 50 cases imported.

name: Yarra Valley
review: A crisp version with good acidity, this offers ripe blackberry and mint flavors, all riding on a lithe frame that plays against refined tannins and a hint of walnut on the long finish. Built to last. Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc, Merlot, Malbec and Petit Verdot. Best after 2016. 50 cases imported.

name: Yarra Valley
review: Sleeker and lighter than most Cabernets, with a sense of finesse to the mineral-accented dark berry and coffee flavors, lingering on the gentle finish. Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc, Merlot, Malbec and Petit Verdot. Drink now through 2018. 25 cases imported.

name: Yarra Valley
review: A distinctive wine, with bright strawberry, currant and mint character that lingers enticingly on the finish, nicely packed with generous, supple flavor. Drink now through 2000. 56 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Yarra Valley
review: Fresh and lively, with pretty pear and pineapple flavors that zing on the finish. Has deftness and elegance. Drink now through 2015. 50 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Yarra Valley
review: Bright and zingy, a crisp wine with juicy apple and quince aromas and flavors, finishing with a hint of apricot. Drink now through 2010. 50 cases imported.

name: Marsanne-Roussanne Yarra Valley
review: Fresh and expressive, full-bodied and rich-flavored, lacking excessive weight, this offers pear, apple and spice notes that echo intensely on the finish. Drink now. 25 cases imported.

name: Yarra Valley
review: Dusty berry and herb flavors are complemented by plum and cassis notes, against a crisp, elegant frame, supple and lingering. Drink now through 2026. 25 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Yarra Valley
review: Fresh and vibrant, offering pretty pear and white peach aromas and flavors, finishing with hints of peach blossom. Drink now through 2014. 50 cases imported.

name: Marsanne-Roussanne Yarra Valley
review: Soft and open-textured, offering pear and cantaloupe flavors on a generous frame. Drink now through 2018. 50 cases imported.

name: Marsanne-Roussanne Yarra Valley
review: Soft and fragrant, with orange and spice notes to add interest to the modest pear fruit. Holds together nicely on the finish. Drink now through 2012. 50 cases imported.

name: Marsanne-Roussanne Yarra Valley
review: Soft and fragrant, a pretty medley of pear, floral and almond flavors that last nicely on the finish. Drink now.

name: Viognier Yarra Valley
review: Vividly aromatic, with plenty of honeysuckle and potpourri notes. Offers a crisp, juicy core of peach and lemon flavors. Drink now. 25 cases imported.

name: Yarra Valley
review: Fresh and appealing, with savory overtones around a polished core of black currant and fennel flavors, lingering on the expressive finish. Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc, Merlot, Malbec and Petit Verdot. Drink now through 2017. 25 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Yarra Valley
review: Light for a Shiraz, with pretty red fruit and hints of roasted meat in the flavor profile, slipping easily into a graceful finish. Drink now through 2017. 25 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Yarra Valley
review: An assertive, gripping acidity up front relaxes into notes of lemon and pear, with a lingering hint of green tea. Drink now. Tasted twice, with consistent notes. 25 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Yarra Valley
review: Light-weight, with pretty apple and spice flavors on a transparent frame. Drink now through 2015. 25 cases imported.

name: Marsanne-Roussanne Yarra Valley
review: Lithe, with a tart edge to the lemon curd and spice flavors, hewing to a narrow beam as the finish lingers quietly. Drink now through 2017. 25 cases imported.

name: Pinot Noir Yarra Valley
review: Very light, with evanescent red berry and tea leaf flavors, lingering delicately. Drink now through 2016. 25 cases imported.

name: Yarra Valley
review: Lithe in structure, this one aims for elegance and shows some modest berry flavors, but a strong earthy, herbal note detracts from the charm. Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc, Merlot, Malbec and Petit Verdot. Drink now through 2012. 50 cases imported.

name: Yarra Valley White
review: Spice, mineral and floral notes add a nice nuance to the apple and melon flavors in this solid, approachable white that's ready to drink. Marsanne and Roussanne. 28 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Yarra Valley
review: Light and sleek, with a candied edge to the raspberry and wet earth flavors. Drink now through 2018. 50 cases imported.

name: Naoussa Paliokalias
review: Nice delicacy, with plenty of dried cherry and succulent spice flavors. Firm finish is filled with smoke and tar. Drink now. 30 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Dry Creek Valley Stromberg Vineyard
review: Delivers a wide range of ripe, juicy, high-toned and vivid blackberry, black cherry and wild berry that ends with a dusty, cedary edge and firm, ripe tannins. Drink now through 2012. 300 cases made.

name: Moulin-à-Vent Les Michelons
review: Open-knit and fresh, with herbes de Provence, violet and bergamot accents to the pomegranate, dried cranberry and smoke notes. Zesty. Drink now through 2018. 580 cases made.

name: Shake Ridge Red Shake Ridge Vineyards Amador County
review: Thick and rustic, with a core of fresh blackberry and blueberry flavors, accented by spice, tobacco and espresso notes. The tannins lend pleasant grip to the finish. Petite Sirah, Syrah, Grenache, Mourvèdre and Graciano. Drink now through 2025. 401 cases made.

name: Syrah Amador County Shake Ridge Vineyards
review: Smoky raspberry aromas lead to a solid structure and appealing flavors of ripe blueberry, pencil lead and roasted herbs. Drink now through 2019. 288 cases made.

name: Syrah Amador County Shake Ridge Vineyards
review: Marked by a rich core of mineral, dried berry and blueberry, this has firm tannins and detailed spice and wet rock notes. Full-bodied and tightly wound. Sure to gain with time. Drink now through 2019. 282 cases made.

name: Barbera Amador County Shake Ridge Vineyards
review: Smoky cherry aromas reveal a hint of leather, leading to zesty plum and grilled herb flavors. Drink now through 2018. 640 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Amador County Shake Ridge Vineyards
review: Soft and jammy, with appealing notes of raspberry, red plum and spice. Drink now through 2018. 414 cases made.

name: Barbera Amador County Shake Ridge Vineyards
review: Lean and herbal, with notes of cherry. Drink now. 522 cases made.

name: Meritage Spring Mountain District
review: Tight and firm, with a compact focus on the chunky currant, mineral, plum and blackberry flavors, it slowly unfolds to reveal more nuances. Should reward patience in the cellar. Made by Cathy Corison. Best from 2002 through 2009. 800 cases made.

name: Meritage Spring Mountain District
review: Bright and lively, with juicy black cherry and blackberry fruit, it's appealing for its fruitiness and subtle complexities that build on the finish, ending with ripe tannins and a creamy oak sensation. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot. Drink now through 2009. 800 cases made.

name: Meritage Spring Mountain District
review: Supple and well-balanced, with a trim band of cedar, herb, anise and currant flavors that never really quite unfold, finishing with herb, bell pepper and tobacco notes. Drink now through 2007. 1,200 cases made.

name: Touriga Nacional Sonoma County Rosé
review: A distinctive rosé. Very dry, with fresh raspberry, vanilla and zesty spice. Drink now. 140 cases made.

name: Meritage Spring Mountain District
review: Firm and intense, with dense black cherry, blackberry, herb and tar flavors, turning smoky. Oak character lingers, along with solid, ripe tannin on the finish. Drink now through 2008. 560 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon San Luis Obispo County
review: Lean and a little crisp, focusing its berry and red cherry fruit, without ever expanding on the finish. Drinkable now. 700 cases made.

name: Chardonnay San Luis Obispo County
review: Crisp and brightly fruity, a zippy mouthful of apple and spice flavors. 900 cases made.

name: Viognier Paso Robles
review: A lean, crisp style, with apple, citrus and pear flavors. Juicy and bright, with a lingering finish. Drink now. 392 cases made.

name: Zinfandel San Luis Obispo County
review: Ripe, complex and tannic, with clean cherry, berry, cinnamon and nutmeg flavors, stiff tannins and good acidity. Needs until about 1994 to show its potential.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon San Luis Obispo County
review: Ripe and mature, with spicy currant and plum flavors that turn soft and fleshy. A graceful, youthful wine that's moderately tannic and smooth on the finish. 290 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon San Luis Obispo County
review: Smooth and fruity, with pretty currant, plum and black cherry flavors of moderate depth and intensity. Shows maturity around the edges and plenty of tannins on the finish. Getting close; try around 1995. 650 cases made.

name: Chardonnay San Luis Obispo County
review: Strikes a nice balance between ripe, earthy pear and citrus notes and toasty buttery oak, finishing with a lingering aftertaste. 920 cases made.

name: Merlot San Luis Obispo County
review: Broad, ripe and flavorful, with herb, cherry and plum notes and soft tannins. Supple enough to drink now. 775 cases made.

name: Zinfandel San Luis Obispo County
review: Spicy and racy, with superripe plum and berry flavors that really fan out. Finishes a bit hot, with a dash of clove. Drink now through 2003. 560 cases made.

name: Albariño Edna Valley
review: Fresh and lively, with floral apricot aromas and crisp tangerine and almond flavors. Drink now. 252 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon San Luis Obispo County
review: Smells ripe and complex, but turns briary, with sage and herb notes on the palate. The cherry and currant flavors develop a tarry edge. Still a bit rough around the edges, but the flavors are good. Drink now. 205 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon San Luis Obispo County
review: Tight and firmly tannic, with ripe plum and cherry notes, it's a well-structured wine that's closed now and in need of time to develop, with a dry, tannic finish. Drink now through 1996.

name: Pinot Noir San Luis Obispo Stephen's
review: Strawberry, cherry, vanilla and tea flavors blend pleasantly on a soft frame. Drink now through 2000. 185 cases made.

name: Zinfandel San Luis Obispo County
review: Ultraripe, jammy and prunelike, but also bearing a subtle pungency. A full-blown style that picks up a tart, earthy, slightly hot aftertaste. 750 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon San Luis Obispo County Reserve
review: Soft, a little watery, with broad berry and beet flavors and supple tannins. Ready now. 200 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir San Luis Obispo County
review: Tea, herb and tobacco flavors dominate the fruit. Turns earthy and tannic on the finish, where it picks up a cola and cherry edge. Try now. 360 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir San Luis Obispo County William Cain Vineyard
review: A bright cherry core is flanked by hints of cola, tea and spice. Finishes a bit dry and short. Drink now through 2000. 550 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir San Luis Obispo County William Cain Vineyard
review: A bit on the light side, with a tart cherry core. The follow-up features smoke, leather and herbs. 595 cases made.

name: Zinfandel San Luis Obispo County
review: Ripe and spicy, with tart, crisp black cherry and raspberry flavors that linger. Not too tannic; drinkable now. 380 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Central Coast
review: Ripe flavor, rough texture, but when it comes together it should be sweet and rich.

name: Pinot Noir San Luis Obispo County
review: Earthy, with dry tannins and a slight green herb edge to the modest cherry flavors. 950 cases made.

name: Chardonnay San Luis Obispo County
review: Surprisingly dark and spicy for a '92, weaving a bit of harsh toast into the otherwise smooth earthy pear flavors. Drinkable now. 410 cases made.

name: Merlot San Luis Obispo County
review: Very ripe and soft. Smells and tastes like blackberries and has a deep but soft texture, medium body and mild tannins. Doesn't need cellaring.

name: Pinot Noir San Luis Obispo County
review: Fresh, fruity, velvety, tart, with lots of blackberry aroma and flavor.

name: Chardonnay San Luis Obispo County
review: Has a green edge, with a bitter, resinous note intruding on the modest apple flavors. 1,050 cases made.

name: Merlot San Luis Obispo County
review: Simple, with a narrow strip of currant, herb and tobacco flavors. Marginal quality, but short-term cellaring should soften it. 1,100 cases made.

name: Chardonnay San Luis Obispo County
review: Odd, with heavy mineral notes and traces of citrus and herb. 555 cases made.

name: Chardonnay San Luis Obispo County
review: Crisp, light and straightforward. Lacks vibrant fruit flavor, but remains spicy and refreshing on the finish. Drinkable now. 950 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir San Luis Obispo County
review: Tough, tannic and earthy; those flavors overriding the cherry and berry notes underneath. Rustic in style. 500 cases made.

name: Zinfandel San Luis Obispo County
review: Firm, lean and earthy, with a green, unripe edge to the cherry and berry flavors. Needs hearty fare to soften the considerable edges. Drink now. 445 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon San Luis Obispo County Carver Vineyard
review: Leads off with smoky, charry notes followed by tar, leather and blackberry flavors. Tannic, bitter finish. 550 cases made.

name: Chardonnay San Luis Obispo County
review: Not for everyone, although some may like this style. Has an unusual earthy, barnyardy aroma and austere, earthy flavors. The texture is rich and the finish lingers.

name: Merlot San Luis Obispo County
review: Earthy, slightly bitter flavors shoulder past the modest fruit. 950 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir San Luis Obispo County
review: Light and simple, with cherry and mint notes that turn candied and lack body and depth. Drink now. 584 cases made.

name: Zinfandel San Luis Obispo County
review: A tart, gamy, earthy edge to the ripe Zinfandel flavors renders this a thin wine that lacks harmony. 450 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir San Luis Obispo County
review: Earthy, bitter and marked by gamy flavors, it lacks ripe fruit and finesse. Finishes with a stemmy edge. 850 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon San Luis Obispo County
review: Tannic with an earthy menthol edge. 550 cases made.

name: Merlot San Luis Obispo County
review: Bizarre, with an unattractive prune and vinegary flavor. Hard to warm up to. 350 cases made.

name: Eleanor of Aquitaine Mendocino
review: Finely focused spicy pear and nectarine flavors, ripe and rich, remain exuberant and generous through the nutmeg-tinged finish. Drink now. 200 cases made.

name: Eleanor of Aquitaine White Mendocino
review: Kicks off with hints of butterscotch, then carries forth pretty grapefruit, mineral and herb flavors. The blend is tight yet well integrated, with an elegant, long finish. A blend of Sauvignon Blanc and Sémillon. Drink now through 2001. 285 cases made.

name: Brut Yorkville Highlands Cuvée
review: Lively and crisp, with modest flavors of green apple, fresh ginger and mineral. Drink now. 400 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Mendocino Randle Hill Vineyard
review: Fresh, crisp and lively, with an elegant band of citrus, particularly grapefruit, and fig flavors. Finishes with a complex earthiness and good length. Brand new winery.

name: Sémillon Mendocino Randle Hill Vineyard
review: Earthy, with dashes of fig and citrus. This is a compact, tightly wound young wine that will benefit from short-term cellaring. Try in 1998.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Mendocino
review: Melon, herb and citrus flavors are carried along nicely by tangy acidity. The wine is tight and firm; not necessarily a sipper, but a fine match for seafood. Drink now through 2002. 662 cases made.

name: Cabernet Franc Mendocino
review: Smoke, cedar and chocolate notes blend harmoniously, followed by nuances of cherry and herbs. The finish is somewhat bitter, though--shut down by coarse tannins. 800 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Yorkville Highlands Randle Hill Vineyard
review: Vanilla and cedar flavors frame lemon, grass and fig flavors. Drink now through 2005. 820 cases made.

name: Sémillon-Sauvignon Blanc Mendocino
review: Shows a stronger oak profile than the other Yorkville Winery whites and is more ponderous, as the fig and citrus flavors are dominated by this oaky presence.

name: Sémillon Mendocino
review: Round and spicy, scented with oak and ripe with pear and caramel flavors. A hint of mineral on the finish. 100 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Anderson Valley
review: Simple and marked by medium bodied honey and apricot flavors. 260 cases made.

name: Sémillon Mendocino
review: Tart and grapefruitlike, this is quite firm and tight on the tongue. Needs oysters or the equivalent. Drink now. 297 cases made.

name: Merlot Yorkville Highlands Rennie Vineyard
review: Quite tart, with smoky black currant and herbal notes. Drink now through 2004. 988 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Mendocino Randle Hill Vineyard
review: Crisp and lemony, a little floral as well; soft enough to settle in with dinner now. 295 cases made.

name: Eleanor of Aquitaine Randle Hill Vineyard Yorkville Highlands
review: Crisp and juicy, but generic, with muted notes of pear and apricot. Sémillon amd Sauvignon Blanc. 300 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Mendocino Randle Hill Vineyard
review: Leans heavily to the earthy side, with a finish that tastes candied.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon St. Helena
review: Deliciously pure, elegant and focused, with a supple, graceful expression of dark berry, currant, plum and light oak flavors. Impressively subtle and finessed. Drink now through 2024. 600 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon St. Helena
review: Dusty, cedary oak notes stand apart from the dried dark berry, anise and underbrush flavors in this red, which maintains a tight profile and should gain in a year or two. Drink now through 2026. 318 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: There's good intensity to the lemon, mango, peach and green papaya flavors, with a nice backbone of acidity and lemongrass flavors on the finish. Drink now. 55,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Ridge Top Estate
review: Balanced, with fine depth to fresh herb, olive, currant and plum tones, nicely highlighted by cedary oak and modest structure. Drink now. 400 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Ridge Top Estate
review: Weaves together ripe black cherry, bay leaf, plum, cocoa and plenty of toasty oak flavors. Firm tannins kick in through the oaky finish. Drink now through 2007. 400 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Napa Valley Premium Estate
review: Racy, fragrant wild berry flavors are tasty, pushing ripeness to near sweet and making it a bit one-dimensional. Drink now through 2006. 400 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir McMinnville Barrel Select
review: Ripe and distinctive for its mineral-accented black cherry and tar flavors, riding smoothly on a bed of polished tannins, finishing with a nice lift of acidity. The flavors persist impressively. Drink now through 2016. 72 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir McMinnville Jordan
review: Broad and generous, with rich, wet forest-accented blackberry, cherry and spice flavors, pushing against firm tannins as the finish gains momentum. Best from 2018 through 2022. 448 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir McMinnville Jordan Block
review: Round, velvety and generous with its root beer-accented black cherry and pepper flavors, lingering enticingly on the open-textured finish. Best from 2008 through 2015. 125 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir McMinnville Natasha Block
review: Crisp in texture, with black pepper prominent in the aroma and flavor range, finishing with attractive blueberry and plum notes against fine-grained tannins. Drink now through 2012. 500 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Barrel Select
review: Velvety, light-footed and expressive, with a welcome density to the raspberry, white chocolate and floral flavors, finishing with elegance. Drink now through 2017. 92 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Cuvée
review: Open-textured, expansive and expressive, layering cherry, blueberry, floral and coffee flavors onto a generous but deftly woven frame, finishing with presence. Best from 2018 through 2024. 243 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Cuvée
review: Taut, focused and expressive, with cherry, dark berry, floral and lime flavors coming together seamlessly on the meaty, deftly formed finish. The flavors hover persistently, bringing you back for another sip. Drink now through 2023. 387 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir McMinnville Jordan Block
review: Bright and generous, offering a lively mouthful of red cherry and spice flavors that persist against lightly crisp tannins on the transparent finish. Drink now through 2014. 350 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir McMinnville Natasha
review: Taut and focused, with blueberry, blackberry and spice flavors playing against nubby tannins as the finish lingers nicely. Best from 2018 through 2024. 437 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir McMinnville Natasha's Noir
review: Bright and jazzy, with raspberry and tangy lime notes competing for attention. Firms up on the finish and picks up cherry and spice character. Needs time to settle down. Best from 2009 through 2015. 50 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Vino Primoroso
review: Lithe and refined, with juicy blackberry and plum aromas and flavors shaded with black pepper and floral notes, finishing with lively acidity. Texture has polish and the wine has plenty of charm. Drink now through 2005. 25 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir McMinnville Jordan Block
review: Crisp, with a tight feel to the fragile currant and berry flavors, picking up steam on the finish to flair nicely. Drink now through 2012. 550 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley
review: Juicy, lively and open-textured, this is bright with a minty edge to its black cherry flavors, lingering effectively on the gentle finish. Drink now through 2017. 450 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley
review: Soft and generous, with pretty black cherry, spice and other extraordinarily subtle notes, all of them echoing nicely on the finish. An exemplary wine from an iffy vintage. Drink now through 2003. 600 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Cuvée
review: Generous, with crisp tannins and juicy cherry, red plum and smoky aromas and flavors that persist against a layer of crunch on the finish. Best from 2017 through 2022. 300 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir McMinnville Jordan
review: Taut, with earthy, meaty notes more prominent than fruit, but it comes together on a sleek finish. For those who prefer a savory style. Best after 2016. 265 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir McMinnville Jordan
review: Dark and spicy, with sassafras and black tea flavors more prominent than dark fruit, finishing on a softly gamy note. Drink now through 2020. 300 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir McMinnville Jordan Block
review: Firm and focused, with layers of spicy, peppery accents to the lean blackberry and currant flavors. Best after 2008. 200 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley
review: Ripe in flavor, solid in structure, with an herbal edge reminiscent of chervil to the black cherry fruit, pleasant if a bit odd. Nicely balanced on the finish to show off the fruit and some black pepper notes. Best from 2002 through 2007. 1,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Vino Mas
review: Firm in texture, with focused leather- and smoke-scented blackberry and cherry flavors, which remain juicy and lively through the finish. Drink now through 2005. 75 cases made.

name: Pinot Blanc McMinnville
review: Light and airy, brimming with pretty pear and melon flavors. A touch of lemon shows on the soft finish. Drink now. 167 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir McMinnville Natasha
review: Chewy with tannin, the flavors coming together underneath as red berry, white pepper and floral notes compete with the texture for attention. Best after 2012. 450 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir McMinnville Natasha Block
review: Light and sprightly, a bright mouthful of raspberry and strawberry fruit, lingering on the refined finish. Drink now through 2011. 650 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Jordan
review: Firm in texture, with fine tannins around a spicy core of red berry and herb flavors, lingering tightly. Best after 2013. 191 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir McMinnville Natasha
review: Bright and deft, with an earthy note weaving through the dark berry and herb flavors, finishing with a diminuendo. Drink now. 136 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley
review: Bright and focused, a lively Pinot Noir, with blackberry and floral aromas and flavors, laced with refreshing acidity. Drink now through 2005. 310 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Natasha
review: Crisp in texture, with gritty tannins around dark berry flavors on a medium-weight frame. Best after 2013. 196 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Jordan
review: Soft and ripe, with a slight tingle to the texture and an earthy note on the finish set against blackberry and spice flavors. Drink now through 2017. 98 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Yamhill County Vino Mas
review: Light and pleasant, with a bit of a kick from the tart berry flavors weaving through the cherry character on the finish. Drink now through 2005. 125 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir McMinnville Barrel Select
review: Meaty aromas and flavors are prominent in this firm-textured, crisply balanced wine, which finishes with a bit of cherry and spice. Best from 2012 through 2018. 100 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir McMinnville Natasha Block
review: A strong petrol character seems out of place with the lively raspberry and floral flavors. Drink now through 2014. 350 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir McMinnville Jordan
review: Gamy flavors pervade this one, obscuring the black cherry fruit.   450 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley
review: Earthy, gamy flavors take over the fruit in this firm, hard-edged red. 400 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Yamhill County Youngberg Hill Vineyard
review: Tart, earthy, not very pleasant. 500 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Yamhill County Youngberg Hill Vineyard
review: Earthy, dirty flavors are not fun. 475 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Just blossoming now, easing out of a taut, oaky, cedary core to reveal rich, juicy blackberry, currant, anise, graphite and cedar notes, ending with tannic grip that lets the flavors ride through. Drink now through 2032. 250 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Napa Valley
review: Orange sherbet, peach and nectarine flavors are ripe and fleshy, with green apple and spicy floral details. A touch of honeycomb lingers on the juicy finish. Drink now.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Napa Valley
review: Lime and kiwifruit flavors are set on a deceptively light body but don't lack focus, intensity or clarity. A whiff of lemon thyme gains momentum on the juicy finish. Drink now. 250 cases made.

name: Proprietary Blend Napa Valley
review: Young and edgy, well-centered on a mix of dark berry, mocha, licorice and gravelly earth flavors. This maintains a rustic personality throughout. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Malbec Drink now through 2028. 250 cases made.

name: Shiraz Barossa Valley Sinners
review: Smooth in texture, with a cooked green bean edge to the cherry flavors. Drink now. 750 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Barossa Valley Craig's
review: Gamy, beefy flavors are most prominent. 750 cases made.

name: Shiraz Barossa Valley Sinners
review: Tart, with a sour cherry and leather edge, turning bitter. 500 cases made.

name: Muscadet de Sèvre et Maine Sur Lie Domaine des 3 Versants
review: Juicy, with mouthwatering lemon and lime zest leading the way for white peach and floral notes. Stays very lively through the finish. Drink now. 250 cases imported.

name: Muscadet de Sèvre et Maine Sur Lie Domaine des 3 Versants
review: Plump and easy in feel, with friendly Key lime and verbena notes. Lacks a bit of typical zip, but remains charming. Drink now. 500 cases imported.

name: Muscadet de Sèvre et Maine Sur Lie Domaine des 3 Versants
review: Lean but fresh, with good citrus peel and herb notes, backed by a mineral twinge. Drink now. 100 cases imported.

name: Muscadet de Sèvre et Maine Sur Lie Domaine des 3 Versants
review: Offers light-bodied thyme and straw flavors, with a hint of peach pit on the finish. Drink now. 350 cases imported.

name: Muscadet de Sèvre et Maine Sur Lie Domaine des Trois Versants
review: Modest lemon verbena and straw notes, with a clean finish. Drink now. 450 cases imported.

name: Muscadet de Sèvre et Maine Sur Lie Domaine des Trois Versants
review: Taut lemon, chalk and mineral notes, with a hint of earth on the crisp finish. Good, but perhaps a bit too lean for most folks. Drink now.

name: Muscadet de Sèvre et Maine Sur Lie Domaine des Trois Versants
review: Soft, with modest apple and floral notes. Lacks zip. Drink now. 8,000 cases made.

name: Muscadet de Sèvre et Maine Sur Lie Domaine des Trois Versants
review: Light-bodied and a bit green and bitter, like a slightly unripe grapefruit. A real palate cleanser. 2,500 cases made.

name: Crozes-Hermitage Le Coteau de la Baume
review: Lush, with enticing flavors of raspberry and blackberry preserves studded with anise and singed apple wood notes. Offers a long, caressing finish. Drink now. 2,000 cases made.

name: Crozes-Hermitage Le Coteau de la Baume
review: Caressing in feel, with polished edges that let the plum sauce, raspberry pâte de fruit and red licorice notes drape nicely. Has just enough freshness to stay honest. Drink now. 2,000 cases made.

name: Gigondas Grand Montmirail Vieilles Vignes
review: Offers a juicy, brambly feel, with blackberry and black currant fruit bouncing along, followed by licorice snap and singed bay notes. Open-knit and accessible now. Drink now through 2017. 450 cases made.

name: Vacqueyras Grand Montmirail
review: A singed alder note provides the frame here, with steeped cherry and damson plum fruit at the core. A subtle iron accent lines the finish. Drink now through 2016. 450 cases made.

name: Vacqueyras Grand Montmirail
review: A polished, friendly style, with a rounded core of plum, blackberry and black cherry flavors followed by a lightly toasted vanilla frame on the finish. A whiff of black tea gives this some needed dimension. Drink now through 2015. 450 cases made.

name: Côtes du Rhône Les Dentelles
review: Features a woodsy, singed juniper and alder frame, with a core of plum skin, steeped raspberry and anise notes. A touch chewy through the finish, showing enough flesh overall. Drink now. 3,000 cases made.

name: Gigondas Grand Montmirail Vielles Vignes
review: A slightly rustic style, with lots of charcoal and fig paste notes, framed by slightly chewy tannins and carrying through a ganache- and bay-tinged finish. Might settle down a little with some cellaring, but this is strictly for fans of the style. Best from 2015 through 2020. 450 cases made.

name: Côtes du Rhône Les Dentelles
review: This has medium-weight, fleshy plum and red currant fruit giving way to singed mesquite and cedar notes that eventually win out on the finish. Drink now. 3,000 cases made.

name: Vosne-Romanée Aux Brûlées
review: An herbaceous cast to the cherry and strawberry flavors in this elegant red. Balanced, with a bright structure that keeps it mouthwatering on the finish. Best from 2007 through 2015. 250 cases made.

name: Vosne-Romanée
review: Floral, black pepper and anise accent the berry flavors in this chewy red. Tight now, but should open soon. Fine balance and snappy fruit. Best from 2007 through 2012. 350 cases made.

name: Condrieu Ayguets
review: Ah, the exotic flavors of a truly botrytized wine. Like a German TBA, this Rhône white is a zingy, full-bodied beauty bursting with clean raw honey, dried apricot, fig, spice, vanilla and grilled pineapple character, thick and hedonistic on the finish. A dessert on its own. Drink now through 2010.

name: Condrieu Les Chaillets
review: Perfumed with intense and elegant aromas of lime, spice and flowers, this sophisticated white moves on to firm, polished flavors of apricot, honey, spice and citrus, pure and deep. It's classically proportioned, balanced and harmonious, with a long, exotic finish. Drink now through 2000. 75 cases made.

name: Condrieu Ayguets
review: Gorgeous ginger cream and singed almond notes lead the way for a sweet, seductive core of dried apricot, tangerine and quince flavors, backed by threads of bitter orange and green tea through the finish. An exotic, dreamy wine. Irresistible now, but should hold easily and broaden out in the cellar. Drink now through 2034. 3 cases imported.

name: Condrieu Essence d'Automne
review: World-class dessert wine. Rich and thick (of course) and very powerful, but the flavors have the purity of sorbet--dried apricot here, fresh peach there, some honey and quince over there--all in a jammy, late-harvest style. Very sweet, very delicious. Drink now through 2025. 150 cases made.

name: Condrieu Les Chaillets
review: A gorgeous display of fruit, this lets yellow apple, quince, green fig, apricot and peach flavors stream along, backed by light twinges of green almond and mirabelle plum. Shows a sense of freshness despite the opulence. Drink now through 2021. 60 cases imported.

name: Condrieu Vertige
review: A huge, youthfully raw Condrieu. Thickly layered anise, roasted fennel seed, Cavaillon melon, quince and persimmon flavors roll through a finish that's both creamy and minerally at the same time. Impressive now, but also has terrific density for cellaring. Drink now through 2013. 250 cases made.

name: Condrieu La Petite Côte
review: Layers of fig, pear, quince, nectarine and yellow apple fruit course through this gorgeous white, gilded with hazelnut oil, orange pith and bitter almond notes. Offers an opulent range, yet remains focused. Shows Viognier's uniqueness. Drink now through 2021. 210 cases imported.

name: Condrieu Les Chaillets
review: A step ahead, with a stunning, lush mouthfeel that lets creamed plantain, Cavaillon melon, elderflower honey, apricot and peach flavors glide along seamlessly, finishing with embers of bitter orange. A beautiful version. Drink now through 2016. 1,416 cases made.

name: Condrieu Les Eguets Récoltes Tardives
review: Marked by great finesse, this is beautifully balanced, with peach, apricot, almond, tropical and spicy flavors. Clean and full-bodied, its silky texture coats the palate. Sweet but not cloying, with an elegant finish. Selected harvest of botrytis-affected grapes. Drink now. 150 cases made.

name: Condrieu Vertige
review: Powerful and dense, showing gorgeous range to the creamed peach, pear, fig and ginger flavors, with lovely mouthfeel on the caressing finish, which is filled with toasted hazelnut and brioche.  This has the buried minerality for finesse and balance, despite its obvious power. A stunner. Drink now through 2016. 341 cases made.

name: Condrieu Vertige
review: This offers a gorgeous combination of power and precision, with creamy layers of fig, anise, yellow apple, cavaillon melon and honeysuckle gliding over one another and through a superlong finish that sports loads of buried minerality. Has plenty of power in reserve for those who like to cellar Viognier. Drink now through 2013. 330 cases made.

name: Côte-Rôtie Bassenon
review: A stunner, with steeped blackberry, boysenberry and loganberry fruit, supported by perfectly melded briar, sweet tapenade, tobacco, bay leaf and singed iron notes. The long finish lets the ferrous note emerge steadily, imparting cut and length. Best from 2015 through 2030. 700 cases made.

name: Côte-Rôtie Madinière
review: This is packed with boysenberry, blackberry and loganberry fruit that races along, while graphite, iron and smoldering mesquite notes fill in through the finish. Displays the grip and drive of the vintage. Best from 2016 through 2025. 800 cases made.

name: Côte-Rôtie Terres Sombres
review: A very racy red, with good cut right from the start, delivering mouthwatering damson plum, red currant, blackberry and bitter cherry notes, seamlessly layered with iron, violet and dark tapenade flavors. The long, pure finish is precise. Best from 2016 through 2026. 908 cases made.

name: Condrieu Ayguets
review: This late-harvest style captures the dried apricot, anise, orange blossom, elderflower and mango side of Viognier, adding an unctuous feel and lingering notes of date, golden raisin and marmalade. Exotic and alluring, this has the cut and underlying purity to age. Drink now through 2020. 122 cases made.

name: Condrieu Ayguets
review: This delivers a terrific beam of pure, distilled apricot and tangerine fruit, with flashes of dried orange peel, golden raisin, date and green tea. Sweet yet racy, with terrific cut on the lengthy finish. Drink now through 2020. 375 cases made.

name: Condrieu Ayguets
review: A lush, exotic sweetie, with captivating aromas and flavors of dried apricot, stewed peach, date and caramel, all backed by a nervy sweet-sour interplay on the finish. Drink now through 2016. 222 cases made.

name: Condrieu Les Chaillets
review: This is packed with creamed pear, green fig, green plum and toasted anise seed notes. The texture is creamy and the finish long and beguiling, thanks to warm brioche and green tea notes that echo through. Drink now through 2014. 1,500 cases made.

name: Condrieu Les Chaillets
review: Beautiful floral, anise and chamomile flower notes unfurl in front of a rich yet racy palate of quince and persimmon flavors. The long finish drips with fruit and minerality. Drink now through 2010. 1,330 cases made.

name: Condrieu Les Eguets Récoltes Tardives
review: Powerful and expressive, with a bounteous botrytis-tasting character, it's thick but clean, with intense dried apricot, orange peel, cigar box and smoke flavors simmering long on the back of the palate. Delicious. Full-bodied. Drink now through 2005.

name: Condrieu Vertige
review: This ripe white offers a plump, friendly core of fig, glazed pear and piecrust notes backed by honeysuckle, persimmon and orange blossom hints. The long, rich finish lets a grilled hazelnut note hang on. Really juicy. Impressive for the vintage. Drink now through 2015. 375 cases made.

name: Condrieu Vertige
review: Big and powerful, with ripe apricot, star fruit and persimmon notes that kick into another gear through the midpalate and finish. Lots of anise and floral notes. Great length and depth. Drink now. 265 cases made.

name: Cornas Les Vires
review: Boldly ripe, yet remarkably detailed, with racy red and black currant, dark plum and hoisin sauce notes liberally laced with maduro tobacco and freshly roasted espresso notes. The rich, fleshy finish has echoes of dark olive in the wings. A gorgeous, modern style Cornas. Best from 2012 through 2020. 5 cases imported.

name: Côte-Rôtie Terres Sombres
review: Black in color, full in body, deep and complex, this is a blockbuster that will need time to deliver all the floral, blackberry and raspberry notes that now brew under a deftly woven blanket of fancy oak. A monumental effort in the unheralded '00 vintage in Côte-Rôtie. Best from 2005 through 2015. 580 cases made.

name: St.-Joseph White Le Lombard
review: Ripe, juicy and bright, with lots of white peach, melon, mirabelle plum and yellow apple flavors laced with mouthwatering verbena and chamomile accents. Offers a light butter hint at the end, which lets the fruit win out easily. Marsanne. Drink now through 2020. 25 cases imported.

name: Condrieu Ayguets
review: Sweet, but with a mouthwatering edge, as the green tea, maple, date, dried orange and persimmon notes flash along electric acidity. Shows lingering ginger and white raisin notes on the finish. Drink now through 2015. 220 cases made.

name: Condrieu Ayguets
review: Quite sweet, this oozes with dried fruit -- peach, raisins, apricots and pineapple. A full-bodied dessert wine, seductive and delicious, delivering some tobacco box and smoke on the wonderful finish. Drink now through 2015. 415 cases made.

name: Condrieu La Petite Côte
review: Toasted coconut and macadamia nut aromas give way to orange curd, apricot, creamed white peach and heather flavors. Lush and draped beautifully, displaying a fine thread of quinine for balance and lift through the finish. Impressive. Drink now through 2016. 2,000 cases made.

name: Condrieu La Petite Côte
review: Rich and flattering, offering apricot, persimmon, peach and anise notes layered together, but with ample acidity for definition and a long, brioche- and green tea-tinged finish that shows impressive range and focus. Drink now through 2014. 1,833 cases made.

name: Condrieu La Petite Côte
review: Dense, with layers of dried mango, peach and papaya fruit intertwined with braised fennel, peach pit and mineral notes. The long finish has surprisingly good grip for a Condrieu. Drink now through 2011. 1,500 cases made.

name: Condrieu Les Chaillets
review: This is really juicy, with a nicely packed core of anise, damson plum, yellow apple and heather honey notes backed by a long, pure, minerally finish. Drink now through 2013. 1,890 cases made.

name: Condrieu Les Chaillets
review: Broad and soft at first, yet quickly knits together, with peach, butter, mango and piecrust notes that gain density and definition through the slightly smoky finish. It grows on you, with a bitter almond hint bringing you back for more. Drink now through 2008. 1,250 cases made.

name: Condrieu Les Chaillets
review: Tender in texture, almost sweet on the palate, this soft, round white offers floral, orange and apricot flavors that linger on the finish. It's harmonious, polished and true to the varietal. A beautiful meditation wine. Drink now through 2000.

name: Cornas Les Vires
review: A toasty style, boasting apple wood and mocha notes, but still steeped in the dark olive, briar and tobacco leaf tug of the appellation. The ample core shows plum paste and roasted fig fruit, with lots of flesh and range. Not imported into the U.S. Best from 2014 through 2024. 391 cases made.

name: Cornas Les Vires
review: A ripe, suave, modern style, with gorgeous black tea and crushed plum aromas, this is silky and driven, with mouthwatering iron, pastis, black olive and açaí berry notes rippling through the long, full-bodied finish. Drink now through 2016. 291 cases made.

name: Cornas Les Vires
review: Lilting and perfumy, especially for Cornas, with sweet tapenade, crushed flower and macerated plum notes backed by incense and spice hints. The long, mouthwatering finish has surprising elegance, with an iron note reverberating prominently. Shows a great combination of terroir and vigneron style. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now through 2020. 290 cases made.

name: Côte-Rôtie Bassenon
review: A very alluring, perfumy style, with white pepper and truffle notes leading the way for dark olive, black tea and mulled blackberry fruit and a long, velvety finish. There's depth here, but this is more about guile and finesse. Best from 2012 through 2021. 665 cases made.

name: Côte-Rôtie Madinière
review: Offers a grippy edge from the start, with briar, pepper and smoldering tobacco notes framing the core of dark plum, fig sauce and blackberry fruit. The long, structured finish echoes with violet and sweet tapenade, with nicely riveted acidity. Best from 2012 through 2022. 875 cases made.

name: Côte-Rôtie Madinière
review: Silky and alluring, with admirable grip supporting notes of black cherry, roasted coffee, macerated olive and currant paste. The suave, fine-grained finish has a nice streak of iron. Best from 2010 through 2020. 890 cases made.

name: Côte-Rôtie Madinière
review: Ripe and sleek, with a beautiful beam of red currant and licorice woven with intriguing mocha, mesquite, iron and dark olive notes. The long finish shows impressive precision, while the mesquite note lends a mouthwatering feel. Best from 2009 through 2020. 665 cases made.

name: Côte-Rôtie Terres Sombres
review: Dark and rich, offering warm fig sauce, cocoa powder and roasted espresso notes driving along muscular structure, with charcoal and macerated black currant fruit holding sway on the back end. Very structured and tight, but densely packed. Should age nicely. Best from 2013 through 2023. 915 cases made.

name: Côte-Rôtie Terres Sombres
review: Tight and supersleek, with a terrific core of blackberry, black cherry and currant fruit laced with mineral, black tea and bittersweet cocoa powder notes. The long, fine-grained finish is precisely balanced for cellaring. Best from 2010 through 2022. 980 cases made.

name: Côte-Rôtie Terres Sombres
review: This is really packed, with dark plum, hoisin sauce, mocha, fig paste, mesquite and sweet tapenade notes, all carried by a dense graphite- and black licorice—filled finish. Shows the grip of the vintage. Best from 2010 through 2020. 750 cases made.

name: Côte-Rôtie Terres Sombres
review: This has aged nicely into a very fine-grained, elegant wine with subtle incense, black tea, red and black cherry and cocoa notes. The long, supple finish ripples with minerality and a hint of dried currant.--1999 Côte-Rôtie non-blind retrospective. Drink now through 2014. 250 cases made.

name: St.-Joseph Les Serines
review: Lovely mulled spice and tobacco notes meld into the core of steeped plum, cassis and boysenberry fruit. Charcoal studs the finish, lending texture and definition, while a gorgeous black tea aroma permeates the lengthy finish. Drink now through 2022. 1,308 cases made.

name: St.-Joseph Les Serines
review: Boysenberry and black currant fruit is wrapped in anise, plum sauce and spice notes, with ample toast on the finish. There's plenty of grip, but a strong graphite edge underneath adds a racy note and bodes well for cellaring. Best from 2012 through 2017. 1,666 cases made.

name: St.-Joseph Les Serines
review: Gorgeous aromas and flavors of warm fig bread, raspberry ganache and boysenberry confiture are laced with superfresh acidity and a bright, minerally spine. Stays tightly focused through the lengthy finish. Drink now through 2012. 1,650 cases made.

name: St.-Joseph Les Serines
review: This is really alluring, with mocha and raspberry ganache leading the way to a silky, fine-grained palate full of dark fruit, spice and mineral notes. The long, fleshy finish lets the iron note hang on nicely. Drink now through 2013. 1,250 cases made.

name: St.-Joseph Les Serines
review: Impressive for its depth, complexity and length. Unbelievable St.-Joseph, in a new-oakish, international style, with delicate floral, mocha, raspberry and spice. Drink now through 2003. 225 cases made.

name: St.-Joseph White St.-Pierre
review: Thoroughly enticing from the start, with creamed pear, green plum, green fig and Cavaillon melon notes all stretching through the creamy, heather-tinged finish. Drink now through 2013. 575 cases made.

name: St.-Joseph White St.-Pierre
review: Despite the rich layers of fig, green plum and glazed pear, this is really focused, thanks to the long, quartz- and lime-tinged finish that ripples with fresh acidity. Drink now through 2011. 500 cases made.

name: Condrieu Ayguets
review: An opulent and heady late-harvest style, this sports broad and rich layers of dried apricot, mango and peach, along with a maple stitching and a praline echo through the finish. A flash of green tea adds intrigue. Drink now through 2021. 20 cases imported.

name: Condrieu La Petite Côte
review: Gorgeous peach, fig and apricot flavors stream along, gilded with light persimmon and ginger hints. There's a lingering anise echo on the finish, which has well-embedded acidity for relative freshness. Drink now through 2018. 180 cases imported.

name: Condrieu La Petite Côte
review: Really enticing, with captivating floral and damson plum aromas, layered with bright anise, braised fennel and mineral notes. There's solid focus and length. Drink now through 2012. 1,875 cases made.

name: Condrieu La Petite Côte
review: A lively and expressive white displaying focused flavors of peaches, spices and pretty floral notes, balanced and so light it dances on the palate. The finish is long and spicy. Polished and irresistible. Drink now through 2000.

name: Condrieu Les Chaillets
review: Juicy and focused, with a range of apricot, nectarine and glazed peach flavors pumping along but staying bright on the finish thanks to an anise edge and nicely woven acidity. Drink now through 2018. 50 cases imported.

name: Condrieu Les Chaillets
review: Racy, with a nicely taut edge to the quinine, quince, fig and pear flavors that ripple through the lengthy, mouthwatering finish. Shows excellent length and precision for the vintage. Drink now through 2014. 1,708 cases made.

name: Condrieu Les Chaillets
review: Impressive. Lovely peach, apricot and dried fruit aromas, with some grilled pineapple and toasted coconut thrown into the mix, this is complex, balanced and harmonious, with ripe flavors and an attractively thick texture. But it's quite woody, so give it time in the cellar. Drink now through 2007. 1,250 cases made.

name: Côte-Rôtie Bassenon
review: Very rich, with nicely detailed tobacco, currant, braised fig, cocoa powder and iron notes that stay intertwined through the dark, fleshy, black tea-tinged finish. Best from 2010 through 2020. 850 cases made.

name: Côte-Rôtie Terres Sombres
review: A warm cocoa aroma is followed by plush, silky plum, black currant, fig and mocha notes. The long, sanguine finish lets black tea and sandalwood notes chime in, while staying ripe and fleshy. Drink now through 2015. 1,016 cases made.

name: St.-Joseph L'Amarybelle
review: A sleek and alluring red, featuring dark tea and smoldering tobacco notes lined with singed mesquite accents. A core of steeped plum, boysenberry and cherry fruit waits in reserve. The long, finish lets the smoldering feel play out. Drink now through 2020. 3,041 cases made.

name: St.-Joseph L'Amarybelle
review: This is mouthwatering, with dark currant, fig and black cherry fruit offset by a riveting chalky spine and a long, iron-filled finish. There's great balance between the flesh and bones. Should age nicely. Drink now through 2017. 2,500 cases made.

name: St.-Joseph L'Amarybelle
review: Really sleek and driven, with lovely mesquite and mocha notes followed by black cherry, fig, fruitcake and black tea notes that glide through the long, fine-grained finish. Drink now through 2012. 1,750 cases made.

name: St.-Joseph L'Amarybelle
review: An awesome St.-Joseph. Deep-colored and ultrasweet, this supple-textured, harmonious red explodes with floral, wild raspberry and toasted oak aromas and flavors. Balanced. Drink now through 2002. 1,500 cases made.

name: St.-Joseph Les Pierres Sèches
review: Piercing mesquite and black tea aromas lead the way, with a dense but silky structure framing the core of lightly mulled boysenberry, blackberry and black currant fruit. A mesquite edge lingers through the fine-grained finish. Very suave. Drink now through 2020. 3,458 cases made.

name: St.-Joseph Les Serines
review: This has impressive drive, depth and focus for the vintage, with layers of dark fig and black cherry fruit offset by a vibrant, iron-filled spine. Notes of espresso and violet fill in on the lengthy, fleshy finish. Drink now through 2013. 1,833 cases made.

name: St.-Joseph White Digue
review: Fresh and open, with a mix of white peach, yellow apple and fennel notes that meld nicely through a lemon curd-accented finish. Shows a light echo of salted butter at the very end. Drink now through 2020. 25 cases imported.

name: St.-Joseph White Le Lombard
review: Very creamy and flattering, with melon, fig and pear fruit and a light toasted brioche note. There's obvious weight, but the finish is pure and floral, giving this balance and length. Drink now through 2012. 650 cases made.

name: St.-Joseph White Le Lombard
review: A gorgeous mix of richness and vibrant minerality, this offers papaya, fig and quince flavors backed by a long finish filled with lime and yellow apple. Has impressive drive. Drink now through 2010. 750 cases made.

name: St.-Joseph White Lyseras
review: Juicy, with inviting apricot, peach and anise notes flanked by a bitter orange accent. Shows a flash of hazelnut oil on the finish. Exotic. Marsanne and Roussanne. Drink now through 2018. 50 cases imported.

name: St.-Joseph White Lyseras
review: Very pure, with a gorgeous, unadorned beam of star fruit, anise, Jonagold apple and Cavaillon melon fruit all gliding through the salted butter-tinged finish. Drink now through 2013. 775 cases made.

name: St.-Joseph White St.-Pierre
review: A lush, broad, toasty style, exhibiting lots of heather, graham cracker, warm piecrust, glazed pear and fig, all layered nicely and gliding through the creamy finish. Not shy in style, but has depth and drive, with a lingering apricot note. Drink now through 2013. 20 cases imported.

name: St.-Péray Biousse
review: A juicy, mouthfilling style, with lots of creamed yellow apple, ginger, white peach and apricot flavors coursing along, backed by light verbena and piecrust accents on the finish. Drink now through 2021. 15 cases imported.

name: St.-Péray Les Cerfs
review: Lush and creamy, with persimmon, verbena, green fig, creamed melon and yellow apple fruit flavors all gliding through the lush, lightly toasty finish with ample but well-embedded acidity. Very long. Drink now through 2012. 375 cases made.

name: Vin de Pays des Collines Rhodaniennes Ripa Sinistra
review: A modern style, with ample mocha and espresso notes followed by solid plum cake, fig sauce and braised cherry fruit flavors. The toasty, licorice-tinged finish is mouthfilling but not tiring. Very solid. Syrah, from Cuilleron's Seysseul vineyards. Drink now through 2014. 5 cases imported.

name: Vin de Table Français Roussillière
review: Sweet and forward, with lush notes of apricot, baked peach, honey, green tea and dried orange peel. The long, sweet finish lets a note of golden raisin linger. Drink now through 2011. 330 cases made.

name: Condrieu
review: Elegant, rich and floral, with pretty spice, pear and citrus flavors that are lively and perfumed. The flavors dance across the palate and last long on the finish. Should improve. Drink now through 1995. 100 cases made.

name: Condrieu La Petite Côte
review: Very pure, displaying fresh-cut pineapple, quince and lemon verbena flavors backed by bright green fig and honeysuckle notes. The long, fresh finish features a quinine note. Drink now through 2013. 1,625 cases made.

name: Condrieu La Petite Côte
review: Creamy and pure, with layers of blanched almond, fig, pear and mango notes that glide to the long, floral finish. Very pure and stylish. Drink now through 2008. 1,415 cases made.

name: Condrieu La Petite Côte
review: Clean and pure, a lovely wine, with plenty of butter, pear tart, toasted oak, grilled pineapple and coconut. A modern Condrieu, medium-bodied and satisfying. Excellent ripe fruit in the midpalate. Long finish. Drink now through 2007. 2,080 cases made.

name: Côte-Rôtie Bassenon
review: Shows good muscle for the vintage, with briar and sweet tapenade notes weaving through the core of currant, fig and black tea. The juicy finish has nice length. Drink now through 2015. 833 cases made.

name: Côte-Rôtie Bassenon
review: Bright, with very juicy raspberry and blackberry fruit notes leading the way for red licorice, mocha, sweet tobacco and mineral hints. Has a long, sleek finish. Drink now through 2018. 665 cases made.

name: Côte-Rôtie Madinière
review: This has a plump core of crushed plum and boysenberry fruit, with alluring mocha, black tea and iron notes weaving around it. Stays perfumy through the suave finish. Drink now through 2014. 825 cases made.

name: Côte-Rôtie Madinière
review: Has a slightly firm edge typical of the vintage, but also plenty of sweet black cherry and currant fruit intertwined with cocoa powder, olive and mineral notes. Long finish fleshes out nicely. Drink now through 2012. 740 cases made.

name: Côte-Rôtie Terres Sombres
review: Plump and open now, this has softened nicely, with dark cherry, plum and roasted fig notes laced with apple wood and iron. There's a flash of tar on the supple flesh.—Non-blind 2001 Côte-Rôtie retrospective (April 2011). Drink now through 2014. 790 cases made.

name: Marsanne Collines Rhodaniennes Les Vignes d'à Côté
review: Lovely white ginger, jasmine, white peach, heather and mirabelle plum notes are juicy in feel but restrained in profile. Fresh acidity lets the elements hang easily. Drink now through 2018. 200 cases imported.

name: Marsanne Collines Rhodaniennes Les Vignes d'à Côté
review: Weighty, but bright and lively too, with lots of mirabelle plum, apricot and white peach fruit flavors pumping forth, backed by verbena and citrus oil accents through the finish. Very tasty. Drink now through 2018. 200 cases imported.

name: St.-Joseph L'Amarybelle
review: This has a good fleshy ripeness for the vintage, with notes of raspberry and cherry preserves flanked by tobacco, savory and olive accents. Offers a light black tea echo and a flash of iron on the finish. Drink now through 2024. 150 cases imported.

name: St.-Joseph L'Amarybelle
review: A fresh, focused style, with a core of steeped black cherry and bitter plum fruit, accented by alluring savory, olive and white pepper notes. Everything pulls together through the sanguine finish. Drink now through 2022. 100 cases imported.

name: St.-Joseph L'Amarybelle
review: A modern style, with toasty espresso and bittersweet cocoa aromas backed by dark plum and ripe blackberry fruit. Long and velvety on the finish, with alluring sanguine and black tea hints. Drink now through 2011. 2,933 cases made.

name: St.-Joseph L'Amarybelle
review: A bold, ripe, modern-styled version, with nearly ebullient blackberry and black cherry fruit harnessed by alluring dark chocolate, black tea and fig bread notes. The long, racy finish has nice graphite and mineral hints. Drink now through 2011. 2,000 cases made.

name: St.-Joseph Les Pierres Sèches
review: A lovely black tea aroma pulls you in, with supple black cherry, red currant and damson plum fruit laced with a perfumy mesquite note. The long, iron-tinged finish is very sleek. Drink now through 2015. 4,165 cases made.

name: St.-Joseph Les Pierres Sèches
review: Nicely juicy for the vintage, with sanguine, iron and mulled cherry notes backed by twinges of briar and lavender. Really rock-solid, with a long finish. Drink now through 2015. 2,683 cases made.

name: St.-Joseph Les Pierres Sèches
review: An elegantly styled version, with supple black cherry, currant, shaved vanilla, incense and sanguine notes that glide through the silky, medium-weight finish. Drink now through 2011. 1,955 cases made.

name: St.-Joseph Les Pierres Sèches
review: A plush style, with an alluring mocha note leading the way for ripe, layered raspberry, chocolate ganache and cocoa notes. Has a long, velvety finish. Drink now through 2012. 1,915 cases made.

name: St.-Joseph Les Serines
review: Alluring vanilla and cocoa powder aromas are followed by slightly firm black cherry, currant and mineral notes. Nice sanguine hint to the finish. Drink now through 2009. 915 cases made.

name: St.-Joseph White Le Lombard
review: Plump and flattering, with creamed melon, dried pineapple and heather aromas and flavors that glide along, framed by a hint of toasted coconut on the finish. Drink now. 683 cases made.

name: St.-Joseph White Le Lombard
review: Fresh and forward, with chamomile, yellow apple and fresh butter hints backed by a dash of peach pit on the finish. Broadens out nicely in the glass, picking up more melon and floral notes. Marsanne. Drink now through 2010. 830 cases made.

name: St.-Joseph White Lyseras
review: Plump and juicy for the vintage, with peach, persimmon and melon flavors backed by a well-integrated note of grilled hazelnut on the finish. Marsanne and Roussanne. Drink now through 2010. 1,000 cases made.

name: St.-Joseph White St.-Pierre
review: Ripe, creamy and smoky, with lush mango, pineapple and quince flavors that don't quit. Long, creamy finish shows mineral and floral hints. Drink now through 2008. 455 cases made.

name: St.-Joseph White St.-Pierre
review: Creamy and ripe, with mango, papaya, almond and floral notes that glide along beautifully. Full-bodied and long on the finish, this wine shows the ripeness of the vintage but stays balanced. Roussanne. Drink now. 455 cases made.

name: St.-Joseph White St.-Pierre
review: Fantastic St.-Joseph. Ripe, rich, silky-smooth and impressive wine, built in a late-harvest style. There is plenty of honey, wet earth, cedar, oak, spices and almond paste complexity, along with dried fig and lime character on the long finish. Drink now through 2010. 415 cases made.

name: St.-Péray Les Cerfs
