review: Very bright, with a superfresh, racy edge to the yellow apple and white peach flavors that linger nicely through the vibrant chalk- and chamomile-tinged finish. Marsanne. Drink now. 440 cases made.

name: St.-Péray Les Cerfs
review: Deliciously creamy up front, with fig, melon and quince flavors that are kept honest by a stony note buried underneath. Very long, with a lingering green plum note that adds dimension. Drink now through 2009. 250 cases made.

name: St.-Péray Les Potiers
review: A lush white, with creamed pear, fig, persimmon and honeysuckle notes, followed by a pure heather honey edge that glides through the finish. Drink now through 2012. 600 cases made.

name: Syrah Vin de Pays des Collines Rhodaniennes Les Candives
review: Ripe and smoky, with a delicious mix of crushed plum, hoisin sauce, clove and tobacco, all laced with a sanguine streak that leaves a mouthwatering feel. Drink now through 2012. 75 cases imported.

name: Syrah Vin de Pays des Collines Rhodaniennes Signé
review: Juicy, with an inviting range of damson plum, raspberry and blackberry fruit woven with mesquite and savory herb notes. The long, fresh finish lets the mesquite edge linger. Drink now through 2012. 10 cases imported.

name: Vin de Pays des Collines Rhodaniennes Ripa Sinistra
review: Deftly toasty, with roasted apple wood notes seamlessly wound into the core flavors of crushed plum, linzer torte and blackberry preserves. Nice cocoa and iron accents echo through the finish. Syrah. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now through 2015. 280 cases made.

name: Vin de Table Français Roussillière M.M.V.I.I.
review: Very sweet, with forward mango, papaya, maple and date notes that cascade over each other through the unctuous finish. A hint of green tea flitters in the background. Drink now. 305 cases made.

name: Viognier Collines Rhodaniennes Les Vignes d'à Côté
review: Lovely fennel, star fruit, peach and apricot aromas and flavors stream through, allied to a rich, creamy feel while staying bright and bouncy through the finish. A delight. Drink now. 116 cases imported.

name: Condrieu Ayguets
review: Showy, sweet Viognier, with all the seductiveness of a late-harvest white: honey, dried fruit, smoke and cream. It's easy to love this wine's charm. Drink now through 2020. 415 cases made.

name: Condrieu La Petite Côte
review: Vividly perfumed, firm and expressive, with clean, fresh acidity providing backbone for the floral, lime, vanilla and honey flavors. It's not opulent, but it's fresh and well focused. Drink now through 1999.

name: Côte-Rôtie Bassenon
review: Alluring cocoa powder and coffee hints give way to slightly firm yet focused black cherry and currant fruit. Long, minerally finish. Drink now through 2012. 705 cases made.

name: Côte-Rôtie Bassenon
review: Wonderful combination of bright floral, red berry character and spicy, smoky, grilled meat and toasted oak notes. Distinctive and complex in aroma, it offers an elegant mouthfeel with a fairly crisp finish. Smells divine now, and should soften with cellaring. Best from 2000 through 2005. 540 cases made.

name: Côte-Rôtie Bassenon
review: This assertive red emphasizes the spicy, gamy side of Syrah, with plenty of black pepper and licorice flavors and very firm tannins. A solid wine that needs time to open. Best after 1997. 100 cases made.

name: Marsanne Vin de Pays des Collines Rhodaniennes
review: Pure Jonagold apple and creamed Cavaillon melon notes combine with a lilting chamomile thread through the creamy, lovely finish. Drink now. 1,166 cases made.

name: Marsanne Vin de Pays des Collines Rhodaniennes
review: Bright and very floral, with lots of chamomile and honeysuckle backed by white peach, Jonagold apple and green fig flavors. The finish is pure and creamy. A delight. Drink now. 380 cases made.

name: Marsanne Vin de Pays des Collines Rhodaniennes
review: Bold and creamy, with delicious mango and papaya notes followed by a long, salted butter finish. Great mouthfeel. Drink now. 415 cases made.

name: Roussanne Collines Rhodaniennes Les Vignes d'à Côté
review: Lovely, with verbena, chamomile, peach and yellow apple notes streaming through, backed by a flash of salted butter. Pure, showing textbook varietal character. Drink now through 2018. 200 cases imported.

name: Roussanne Collines Rhodaniennes Les Vignes d'à Côté
review: Delightful, with a creamy edge and a bright, floral-laced core full of star fruit, green melon, yellow apple and verbena notes. The seamless finish has just a kiss of butter. Drink now through 2017. 200 cases imported.

name: Roussanne Vin de Pays des Collines Rhodaniennes
review: Offers lovely apricot, tangerine and white peach notes, with a flicker of spice and a juicy, mouthfilling finish. Drink now. 1,083 cases made.

name: Roussanne Vin de Pays des Collines Rhodaniennes
review: Lush and creamy, with lovely melon, apricot and yellow apple flavors kissed gently by toast through the pure, delicious finish. Drink now. 380 cases made.

name: Roussanne Vin de Pays des Collines Rhodaniennes
review: Focused, with quince, fig and peach flavors backed by nice minerally notes on the long, juicy finish. Drink now. 165 cases made.

name: St.-Joseph L'Amarybelle
review: Nice flesh for the vintage, with smoke and tobacco notes leading the way for black cherry, currant and plum fruit. Lacy finish shows nice length. Drink now through 2009. 1,665 cases made.

name: St.-Joseph L'Amarybelle
review: Amazing quality. Rich, thick, intense. Full-bodied, with tar, smoke and charcoal, offering loads of fruit. Long, fresh, crisp finish. Best from 2002 through 2010. 1,250 cases made.

name: St.-Joseph Les Pierres Sèches
review: Shows the slightly mature, leafy profile of the vintage, emphasizing bay leaf, savory and tobacco notes out front, followed by gently mulled cherry and plum fruit flavors. Reveals a pretty incense accent on the finish. Drink now through 2022. 150 cases imported.

name: St.-Joseph Les Serines
review: Impressive wood has produced a full-bodied wine, with silky texture, lots of tar, smoke, blackberry and grilled bacon. Has delightful fresh citrus (acidity) on the aftertaste, saving this showy Syrah from turning heavy-handed on the elegant, succulent finish. Best from 2003 through 2007. 830 cases made.

name: St.-Joseph Les Serines
review: Impressive. Inky black, a brooding and big St.-Joseph. Full-bodied, with crisp, clean and pure fruit profiled against lovely smoky, spicy, mocha-scented oak notes. Firm finish; cellar short-term. Best from 2003 through 2008. 830 cases made.

name: St.-Joseph White Le Lombard
review: Shows the crisp, citrus-tinged edge of the vintage, but has a good plump feel at the core, with buttered almond, melon and pear notes. There's solid length and depth. Drink now through 2011. 791 cases made.

name: St.-Joseph White Le Lombard
review: Offers lots of melon, butter, peach and smoke notes, backed by fine minerality, with a broad, honeyed finish. Drink now through 2008. 455 cases made.

name: St.-Joseph White Lyseras
review: Bold, with ginger powder, acacia flower, lemon verbena and melon aromas and flavors. Ripe and creamy throughout, with a dash of firmness on the finish. Marsanne and Roussanne. Drink now through 2006. 415 cases made.

name: St.-Joseph White Lyseras
review: Like a little Condrieu. Rich and ripe, with a lovely, lush floral, white peach, almond, butter, macadamia nut and honey character of full-bodied complexity all the way to the seductive, late-harvest-like finish. Drink now through 2000.

name: St.-Joseph White St.-Pierre
review: Enticing, with a range of peach, quince and dried pineapple fruit flavors backed by a hint of toast on the open-knit finish. Roussanne. Drink now. 830 cases made.

name: St.-Péray Les Cerfs
review: A ripe, tropical style, with orange peel, dried apricot and warm peach notes, lined with piecrust and brioche flavors. Delivers a broad, open finish. For the hedonist crowd. Drink now. 375 cases made.

name: St.-Péray Les Cerfs
review: Pure and clean, with racy lime- and lemon-inflected floral, peach and straw notes, followed by a stony hint on the finish. Should fill out a touch more with modest cellaring. Drink now through 2011. 350 cases made.

name: St.-Péray Les Potiers
review: A lush, creamy style, with glazed Jonagold apple and pear notes, backed by peach, tangerine and heather honey hints that linger through the finish. Drink now. 566 cases made.

name: St.-Péray Les Potiers
review: Fresh, with a stony edge to the persimmon, lemon verbena and chamomile notes. The long, bright finish has a nice lingering citrus peel note. Drink now. 458 cases made.

name: St.-Péray Les Potiers
review: Bright and nicely focused, with a clearly defined minerality that stretches out the Jonagold apple, honeysuckle and lemon verbena notes. The finish is long and pure. Marsanne. Drink now through 2010. 525 cases made.

name: St.-Péray Les Potiers
review: A flashy, rounded style, with a hint of hazelnut leading the way for fig, persimmon and orange blossom notes. Has a long, creamy finish. Drink now. 500 cases made.

name: Syrah Vin de Pays des Collines Rhodaniennes
review: A silky red, with tangy-edged plum, red currant and black tea notes backed by a long, fine-grained, iron-filled finish. There's good cut, thanks to the fine acidity. Drink now through 2012. 400 cases imported.

name: Syrah Vin de Pays des Collines Rhodaniennes Les Candives
review: Silky and pure, with violet, plum and black cherry notes kissed by a touch of cocoa powder on the fine-grained finish. Very tasty. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Syrah Vin de Pays des Collines Rhodaniennes Les Candives
review: Really juicy and ripe, but nicely focused, with dark currant and cherry fruit woven with violet, sanguine and iron notes, followed by a long, polished finish. Drink now through 2009. 500 cases made.

name: Syrah Vin de Pays des Collines Rhodaniennes Ligné
review: A taut, tangy, mineral-driven style, with racy black cherry, iron and floral notes backed by a nice sanguine hint on the finish. Drink now. 583 cases made.

name: Viognier Vin de Pays des Collines Rhodaniennes
review: Ripe, featuring full-bodied flavors of quince, Jonagold apple and Cavaillon melon. Stays fresh and pure, with fennel, heather and honeysuckle notes adding lift through the juicy finish. Drink now. 3,583 cases made.

name: Viognier Vin de Pays des Collines Rhodaniennes
review: Open and inviting, with delicious creamed melon, green fig and green plum notes all caressed by hints of anise and fennel frond through the rounded finish. Drink now. 1,280 cases made.

name: Viognier Vin de Pays des Collines Rhodaniennes
review: Enticing, with attention-grabbing anise and green apple aromas and flavors backed by a bracing hint of fennel on the finish. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Condrieu La Petite Côte
review: Lovely. Ripe and vibrant, a balanced, medium-bodied Condrieu that explodes with lively tropical, lime and mineral flavors. A delight to drink. Drink now through 2005. 1,665 cases made.

name: Côte-Rôtie Bassenon
review: Lighter in body, with perfumy cherry, spice and toasted vanilla hints giving way to more tea and sandalwood on the sous bois-tinged finish, where the tannins are dusty and persistent.—Non-blind 2001 Côte-Rôtie retrospective (April 2011). Drink now. 705 cases made.

name: Côte-Rôtie Terres Sombres
review: This has a relatively good juicy feel for the vintage, with a modest mix of red and black cherry fruit set against light bramble, bay leaf and olive notes. Fleshes out a bit on the finish, showing good peppery energy. Best from 2018 through 2024. 20 cases imported.

name: Côte-Rôtie Terres Sombres
review: Firm and smoky, with medium-weight briar, coffee, olive and cocoa notes that mingle with the dark cherry fruit. Taut finish lets the cocoa note linger. Richer than the Bassenon, but not as fine-grained. Drink now through 2011. 655 cases made.

name: Beaune White Clos des Mouches
review: Pretty apple and cream aromas and flavors. Medium in body, showing loads of toasted coconut and vanilla character and a delicate, fruity finish.

name: Beaune White Clos des Mouches
review: Rich and oily texture, toasty and smoky, with modest spice, vanilla and pear flavors and a subtle finish.

name: Côte-Rôtie Cuvée Jyl
review: Solid, with a core of fig sauce, currant and black olive notes wrapped with a cloak of bittersweet cocoa and fig bread notes. Juicy, if a bit compact on the finish. Contains 3 percent Viognier. Sourced from the Leyat, La Brosse and Truchet lieux-dits. Drink now through 2016. 375 cases made.

name: Saumur White Domaine de St.-Just Coulée de St.-Cyr
review: Just off-dry, sporting candied nectarine and clementine notes up front, turning racy and floral-edged, with chamomile, yellow apple and white peach notes racing through the mouthwatering finish. Drink now through 2019. 500 cases made.

name: Saumur-Champigny Domaine de St.-Just Clos Moleton
review: Dark and racy, with charcoal and graphite accents supporting the crushed plum, blackberry and boysenberry coulis notes. Shows lots of mouthwatering briar through the finish, revealing some slightly mature spice hints, with the stuffing for a touch more cellaring. Drink now through 2017. 200 cases made.

name: Saumur White Domaine de St.-Just
review: Plump at the core but tangy along the edges, this sports plantain, brioche and yellow apple notes framed by crème fraiche and green almond. The long, lively finish has finely beaded acidity. Drink now through 2017. 5,000 cases made.

name: Saumur-Champigny Domaine de St.-Just Les Terres Rouges
review: Features a velvety mouthfeel, with dark plum, steeped currant and blackberry fruit gliding along, inlaid with smoldering charcoal and dark olive notes. The fleshy finish remains focused and supple. Drink now through 2014.

name: Saumur-Champigny Domaine de St.-Just Montée des Roches
review: Showing some maturity already, with a tobacco edge emerging from the core of dark plum and black currant fruit. Notes of singed cedar and bay chime in on the finish. Retains the grip of the vintage despite the slightly advanced aromatics. Drink now through 2014.

name: Saumur White Coulée de St.-Cyr
review: The fresh pear and yellow apple fruit is lined with a melon rind flavors. A note of fresh salted butter takes over on the finish. Drink now through 2015. 800 cases made.

name: Saumur White Domaine de St.-Just Coulée de St.-Cyr
review: Nicely ripe for the vintage, with ginger, quince, persimmon and cardamom notes that weave through the elegant, minerally finish. Drink now through 2010. 150 cases imported.

name: Saumur-Champigny Domaine de St.-Just
review: Grilled savory and bay flavors stud this wine, with a core of roasted plum and mulled cherry fruit. The bay leaf note lingers on the finish, revealing a chalky echo. Drink now through 2014.

name: Brut Rosé Crémant de Loire Domaine de St.-Just
review: Bright, with floral-edged white cherry, peach and raspberry notes racing along, revealing a cherry pit echo on the finish. Drink now. 35,000 cases made.

name: Saumur Domaine de St.-Just Montée des Roches
review: Offers a good enticing tobacco aroma, with fresh, elegantly styled red and black cherry fruit backed by a twinge of iron on the finish. Drink now. 150 cases imported.

name: Saumur White Domaine de St.-Just Les Perrières
review: Fresh and open, with juicy white peach and melon rind notes, revealing a lingering honeysuckle edge on the pleasantly brisk finish. Drink now.

name: Saumur-Champigny Domaine de St.-Just
review: Bramble, red currant and damson plum flavors form the core, with a light savory shading on the racy finish. Drink now. 2,000 cases made.

name: Saumur-Champigny Domaine de St.-Just
review: Light on structure, but fresh and balanced, with a piercing feel to the bitter cherry, red currant and violet notes. A flicker of savory adds range to the finish. Drink now through 2015. 2,000 cases made.

name: Saumur-Champigny Domaine de St.-Just
review: Ripe, but softened already, with a lightly mulled spice edge emerging from the core of plum and blackberry fruit. A smoky tobacco hint weaves through the finish. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Saumur-Champigny Domaine de St.-Just Les Terres Rouges
review: Racy and fresh, with a piercing feel to the red currant, cherry and savory notes. Flickers of olive and iron line the finish. Not big, but pure and energetic. Drink now. 1,250 cases made.

name: Brut Crémant de Loire
review: This sparkler has a soft, caressing feel, with a mix of green almond, melon and apple notes gliding easily through the finish. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Brut Crémant de Loire Domaine de St.-Just
review: This toasty sparkler displays well-meshed flavors of pear, fig and green apple, with a plump, piecrust-tinged finish. Drink now. 3,500 cases made.

name: Saumur White Domaine de St.-Just
review: A bright, floral style, with white peach and honeysuckle notes on a light, elegant frame. Drink now. 250 cases imported.

name: Saumur White Domaine de St.-Just Coulée de St.-Cyr
review: Rounded and easy in feel, with yellow apple, straw, piecrust and white ginger notes. The open finish has just enough acidity to maintain momentum. Drink now. 1,100 cases made.

name: Saumur White Domaine de St.-Just Les Perrières
review: Plump and open-knit, with ginger and quince chutney notes out front, backed by green apple and fennel accents that give the finish needed zip. Drink now. 450 cases made.

name: Saumur-Champigny Domaine de St.-Just
review: Fresh, with pleasantly crunchy acidity carrying the pomegranate, cherry pit and tobacco notes along. Offers a breezy, unadorned finish. Drink now. 1,700 cases made.

name: Brut Rosé Crémant de Loire
review: This sparkler has fresh cherry and strawberry notes, with a flash of watermelon rind to keep the finish honest. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Franc Saumur-Champigny Domaine de St.-Just
review: Forward, with a rounded, easygoing feel to the black cherry, cigar smoke and modest spice notes. Drink now. 250 cases imported.

name: Saumur White Domaine de St.-Just Les Perrières
review: Soft and rounded, with a waxy edge to the apple, white peach and quince notes. A light hint of piecrust carries through the finish. Drink now. 400 cases made.

name: Saumur-Champigny Domaine de St.-Just Montée des Roches
review: A brisk red, with sinewy edges, offering a core of plum pit, bitter cherry and red currant fruit, showing a distinct lacing of savory and pine notes. This herbal style displays good energy. Drink now through 2015. 500 cases made.

name: Brut Crémant de Loire
review: A crisp, lively sparkler, with lemon and lime notes backed by a touch of pear fruit and a fresh, floral finish. Drink now. 250 cases imported.

name: Brut Rosé Crémant de Loire
review: Soft and elegant, with cherry and watermelon rind notes that linger gently on the finish. Drink now. 500 cases imported.

name: Saumur-Champigny Domaine de St.-Just Les Terres Rouges
review: Forward and open-knit, with a modest mix of strawberry and red currant fruit, flecked with white pepper and herb notes. Drink now. 1,600 cases made.

name: Sancerre Chavignol
review: This is bony at first, with talcum powder and chive notes up front, then turns richer as it moves along, letting lime zest and salted butter notes fill in, with a long, flinty finish. Drink now through 2013. 1,000 cases imported.

name: Sancerre Chavignol
review: A light straw note weaves through the mix of grapefruit, lemon curd and gooseberry flavors. Offers an herbal flash on the tangy finish. Drink now through 2019. 2,225 cases imported.

name: Sancerre Chavignol
review: Bouncy, with a juicy edge to the white peach, kaffir lime and lemon zest notes that ripple through the finish. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Sancerre Chavignol
review: Features lemon curd, gooseberry and honeysuckle notes, with a stone-tinged finish that is light and pure. Drink now. 1,500 cases imported.

name: Sancerre Chavignol
review: Not big, but persistent, with nice focus to the chive, sweet pea, flint and lime flavors that ripple through the finish. Drink now through 2010. 1,500 cases imported.

name: Sancerre Red
review: Shows fresh black cherry and briar flavors, with notes of spice and truffle. Slightly rustic finish, but good core of fruit. Drink now.

name: Sancerre Chavignol
review: Soft, with blowsy lemon notes and a vegetal (asparagus) streak. A second bottle was corky.

name: Germany Prestige Carte Noi
review: Sweet and simple sparkler, like lemon-lime soda pop.

name: Pouilly-Fumé
review: Muscular yet vibrant, this powerful white offers ripe pear and apple flavors, with bright notes of grapefruit, smoke and minerals. Balanced and well defined. Should age well. Drink now through 2002. 4,000 cases made.

name: Volnay Premier Cru
review: Velvety and perfumed, with lovely black currant, mint and cherry notes, silky texture and a supple finish. Drink now. 225 cases made.

name: Volnay Les Caillerets
review: Elegance defines this Volnay. Lovely black currant, mint and chestnut aromas and flavors are presented in a subtle package, ending with round tannins. Drink now. 125 cases made.

name: Volnay
review: Nice, juicy and flavorful, offering berry and earth notes. Attractive in an elegant way. Drink now. 330 cases made.

name: Volnay En Verseuilles
review: Fresh but light, this medium-bodied wine offers good berry flavors and lively tannins. Drink now. 330 cases made.

name: Bourgogne
review: Nicely focused and fresh, but light, with bright strawberry notes. Drink now. 250 cases made.

name: Pommard Les Rugiens
review: Surprisingly light, showing simple strawberry and cherry aromas and flavors. 200 cases made.

name: Merlot Vin de Pays des Côtes de Gascogne
review: A red with personality. Quite peppery in character, with good cherry and berry flavors, some interesting cedary nuances, too--all nicely integrated and lingering on the finish. Drink now. 20,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Vin de Pays du Comté Tolosan Premius
review: Redolent of herbs and a hint of ramps, with some mineral notes on the lively finish. Drink now. 230 cases imported.

name: Colombard-Chardonnay Vin de Pays des Côtes de Gascogne
review: Medium-bodied, showing flavors of citrus, mineral and spice, with tropical fruit notes on the finish. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Merlot Vin de Pays de l'Aude
review: Medium-bodied, with plum and berry flavors, followed by savory herbs on the finish. Drink now. 8,000 cases made.

name: Merlot Vin de Pays des Côtes de Gascogne
review: An appealing richness underlies flavors of strawberry and red currant, but there's not much depth. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Vin de Pays des Côtes de Gascogne
review: A disjointed wine, with soft berry flavors that never quite mesh with the astringent tannins. May be better in 1999. 15,000 cases made.

name: Bordeaux Yvecourt
review: Simple and very grapey. Medium-bodied, with firm, rather dry tannins and a slightly hollow finish. Better after this year.

name: Bordeaux Officiel du Bicentenaire de la Revolution Francaise
review: A white wine that is very floral and fruity in aroma, but it tastes simple and straightforward, with subdued grassy, lemony flavors.

name: Shiraz Vin de Pays de l'Aude
review: Stewy and spicy, with modest red berry flavors. 8,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Bordeaux
review: A soft and simple white wine, watery and vague in flavor. 20,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Gris Bordeaux
review: Very soft, simple and fruity; a coarse wine that's drinkable now.

name: Bordeaux Officiel du Bicentenaire de la Revolution Francaise
review: Basic Bordeaux. Tastes generally fruity and clean, if a bit too harsh. Ultimately simple. Slightly better than previously reviewed.

name: Fleurie
review: This tender red has nicely delineated flavors of cherry, smoke and herb. Round on the palate, at once generous and firm enough for food. Harmonious and balanced. Drink now.

name: Fleurie
review: This rich red is atypical for a modern Beaujolais: It's highly extracted, with muscular tannins, and the flavors focus on the meaty, smoky end of the spectrum, with a core of ripe cherry that needs time to express itself. Drink now through 2004.

name: Chablis Blanchots
review: Bright, crisply focused aromas and flavors of apple, pineapple and minerals are tightly wrapped in a sturdy frame. It needs time to lose its austerity and start picking up texture. Drinkable now with oysters, and maybe around 1993 with fish.
